title: Accounting and Finance (BSc)
summary: The BSc Accounting and Finance course at the University of Bristol offers a fully integrated degree that combines both disciplines, preparing students for careers in the field. It emphasizes problem-solving skills and provides insights into accounting institutions and financial markets through research-led teaching. The course includes opportunities for internships and professional networking, ensuring graduates are well-equipped for the job market.

requirements.A-level standard offer: AAA including Mathematics, or A*AB including A in Mathematics
requirements.BTEC: DDD in any Applied General BTEC National Level 3 Extended Diploma, AND A in Maths at A-level (or equivalent)
requirements.International Baccalaureate: 36 points overall with 18 at Higher Level, including Mathematics

structure: Year 1 focuses on strengthening problem-solving skills with mandatory units in Accounting, Finance, Economics, Mathematics, and Statistics. Year 2 builds on these principles with deeper studies in Financial Accounting and Management Accounting. The final year consolidates learning and offers flexibility in unit selection, allowing for specialization or interdisciplinary options.

title: Accounting and Finance with Professional Placement (BSc)
summary: The BSc Accounting and Finance with Professional Placement is a four-year integrated degree that combines Accounting and Finance subjects, allowing students to gain industry experience during a paid placement in their third year. The course prepares students for careers in accounting, finance, or investment banking, with access to professional accreditation opportunities. Graduates benefit from strong employability services and connections with leading organizations.
requirements: Typical offers include a variety of qualifications; specific A-levels or equivalent are not detailed. English language requirements include IELTS 6.5 overall with 7.0 in reading and listening, or GCSE English Language grade C or 4.
structure: Year 1 focuses on problem-solving skills and fundamental principles of Accounting and Finance. Year 2 builds on these principles with more advanced topics and optional units. Year 3 involves a paid placement, and Year 4 consolidates learning with advanced skills and greater flexibility in unit selection.

title: Accounting and Finance with Study Abroad (BSc)
summary: The BSc Accounting and Finance with Study Abroad is a four-year integrated degree that combines Accounting and Finance subjects, allowing students to spend their third year studying abroad at a leading university. The course prepares students for careers in accountancy or finance, providing access to accredited subjects and opportunities for internships and professional networking.

requirements.A-level standard offer: AAA including Mathematics, or A*AB including A in Mathematics
requirements.BTEC: DDD in any Applied General BTEC National Level 3 Extended Diploma and A in mathematics at A-level (or equivalent)
requirements.International Baccalaureate: 36 points overall with 18 at Higher Level, including Mathematics

structure: Year 1 focuses on strengthening problem-solving skills with mandatory units in Accounting, Finance, Economics, Mathematics, and Statistics. Year 3 is spent abroad, and Year 4 consolidates learning with advanced skills and greater flexibility in unit selection.

title: Accounting and Management (BSc)
summary: The BSc Accounting and Management course at the University of Bristol is a three-year professionally accredited program that integrates accounting and management subjects. It aims to equip students with the skills necessary for various career paths in accounting, consulting, and management. Students will develop critical thinking, interpersonal skills, and a solid understanding of financial and non-financial data.

It aims to equip students with the skills needed for various career paths in accounting, consulting, and management, while also enhancing their understanding of organizational operations. Students will develop critical thinking and interpersonal skills essential for success in their professional careers.
requirements: This course is available by transfer only from BSc Accounting and Management (UCAS code NN42). English language requirements include IELTS 6.5 overall with 7.0 in reading and listening, or GCSE English Language grade C or 4.

The third year includes a professional placement, and the final year deepens knowledge in accounting and management with opportunities to specialize.

It aims to equip students with the skills needed for various career paths in accounting, consulting, and management, focusing on both financial and non-financial data interpretation. Students will develop critical thinking and interpersonal skills essential for success in their professional careers.

The program emphasizes group work and personal development, preparing graduates for diverse career paths in accounting and innovation.

title: Aerospace Engineering (BEng)
summary: The BEng Aerospace Engineering course at the University of Bristol is a three-year program that combines advanced theory with practical experience. It covers a wide range of subjects across four main themes: aerodynamics, structures and materials, dynamics and control, and systems and design. Students will engage in hands-on projects and research, preparing them for diverse applications in aerospace and renewable energy.

Year 2 includes specialization in demanding units such as aerodynamics and space systems engineering, along with a group design-build-test project. Year 3 concentrates on advanced topics and an individual research project.

title: Aerospace Engineering (MEng)
summary: The MEng Aerospace Engineering course at the University of Bristol is a four-year program that combines advanced theoretical knowledge with practical experience. Students will explore a range of subjects including aerodynamics, structures, dynamics, and systems design, preparing them to tackle engineering challenges in aerospace. The course includes hands-on projects and research opportunities, culminating in an industry-focused design project in the final year.

Year 4 consists of a capstone group design project and optional units in specialized areas.

title: Aerospace Engineering with Study Abroad (MEng)
summary: The MEng Aerospace Engineering with Study Abroad is a four-year course that combines core aerospace engineering education with an opportunity to study at an English-speaking partner university abroad during the third year. Students will engage in a variety of subjects, including aerodynamics and systems design, and will complete an industry-focused design project in their final year. This program aims to equip students with the skills needed for a successful career in the aerospace industry.
requirements: This course is available by transfer only. Applicants must meet specific GCSE and English language requirements, including IELTS 6.5 overall with 6.0 in all skills or equivalent qualifications.
structure: Year 1 focuses on foundational engineering principles, Year 2 specializes in aerospace topics such as aerodynamics and materials, Year 3 is spent studying abroad with advanced aerospace topics, and Year 4 includes a capstone design project and optional specialist units.

title: Aerospace Engineering with a Year in Industry (BEng)
summary: The BEng Aerospace Engineering with a Year in Industry is a four-year course that combines theoretical knowledge with practical experience in an industrial environment during the third year. It covers a wide range of subjects including aerodynamics, structures, dynamics, and systems design, preparing students for future engineering challenges. The course emphasizes teamwork, presentation skills, and hands-on projects, culminating in a research project in the final year.
requirements: This course is available for transfer only. Specific A-levels or equivalent qualifications are required, along with a successful industry interview.
structure: Year 1 focuses on core engineering concepts and interdisciplinary projects. Year 2 includes specialized aerospace engineering topics and a design-build-test project. Year 3 involves a placement, and Year 4 centers on advanced aerospace topics and an individual research project.

title: Aerospace Engineering with a Year in Industry (MEng)
summary: The MEng Aerospace Engineering with a Year in Industry is a five-year course that combines theoretical knowledge with practical experience in an industrial environment during the third year. Students will study core concepts in the first two years, engage in a research project in the fourth year, and complete an industry-focused design project in the final year. The course aims to equip students with the skills needed to tackle future engineering challenges in aerospace.
requirements: Entry is by transfer only from specific aerospace engineering courses. English language requirements include IELTS 6.5 overall with 6.0 in all skills or GCSE English Language grade C or 4.
structure: Year 1 focuses on foundational technical knowledge and interdisciplinary projects. Year 2 includes specialisation in aerospace engineering with demanding units. Year 3 involves a placement, Year 4 concentrates on advanced topics and research projects, and Year 5 features a capstone design project with optional specialist units.

title: Ancient History (BA)
summary: The BA in Ancient History at Bristol allows students to explore real-world issues through the study of ancient Mediterranean cultures. The program emphasizes critical thinking, analysis of historical evidence, and effective argumentation, preparing graduates for diverse careers. Field trips to ancient sites enhance the learning experience, and students can engage in independent research and creative projects.

title: Anthropology (BA)
summary: The BA Anthropology course at the University of Bristol offers a unique opportunity to explore the social, material, linguistic, and evolutionary aspects of human experience. It equips students with the skills to apply anthropological theory and research techniques to address contemporary challenges, culminating in a substantial final-year dissertation. Students will engage in both qualitative and quantitative methodologies, preparing them for fieldwork and original research.

title: Applied Anatomy (BSc)
summary: The BSc in Applied Anatomy at the University of Bristol provides a comprehensive understanding of human and veterinary anatomy through practical teaching, including dissection. The program emphasizes comparative anatomy and the structure of major mammalian body systems, culminating in an original research project in the final year. Graduates are equipped with essential skills for various career paths in health professions, research, and education.

The course culminates in an independent research project and a seminar session designed by the students themselves.

Students will engage in fieldwork and produce a substantial dissertation, supported by original research and teaching.

title: Social Policy and Politics (BSc)
summary: The BSc Social Policy and Politics course combines the study of social policy, focusing on wellbeing, with politics, examining power dynamics in society. Students will explore the organization of society and the distribution of wellbeing, while engaging with political theory, comparative politics, and international relations. The program emphasizes research-led teaching and the development of transferable skills for future careers.

title: Social Policy and Sociology (BSc)
summary: The BSc Social Policy and Sociology joint honours degree at the University of Bristol explores key issues within public and social life, combining Social Policy's focus on wellbeing with Sociology's insights into contemporary societies. Students will critically analyze social structures, institutions, and real-world challenges related to inequality and crime, while developing valuable transferable skills for their careers.

title: Social Policy with Criminology (BSc)
summary: The BSc Social Policy with Criminology course at the University of Bristol offers students the opportunity to critically analyze contemporary social issues related to human wellbeing, inequality, disadvantage, and crime. It combines the study of social policy with criminology, exploring the nature and causes of crime and the effectiveness of policy responses. Students will engage with real-world challenges and develop research and critical thinking skills throughout the program.

title: Sociology and Philosophy (BSc)
summary: The BSc Sociology and Philosophy course at the University of Bristol offers a balanced education in both disciplines, emphasizing sociological theory and its real-world applications alongside a comprehensive understanding of philosophy. Students will engage with topics such as consumption, the environment, and ethics, while developing critical thinking and research skills. The program includes workshops, guest speakers, and social events to enhance the learning experience.

title: Sociology with Study Abroad (BSc)
summary: The BSc Sociology with Study Abroad course at the University of Bristol explores the structures, actions, and cultural practices of society, equipping students with a sociological imagination. Students will engage with a vibrant academic community and develop valuable transferable skills through workshops, guest speakers, and research opportunities. The course includes a year studying sociology abroad, providing a unique perspective on different societies and cultures.

title: Sociology (BSc)
summary: The BSc Sociology course at the University of Bristol explores the structures, actions, and cultural practices of society, equipping students with the skills to understand social changes. Students will engage with a vibrant academic community and benefit from workshops, guest speakers, and support for student societies. The program emphasizes skills development, preparing graduates for various career paths.

structure: Year 1 provides a solid grounding in sociology, while Year 2 offers a greater choice of units linked to staff research interests. Mandatory units in the first and second years prepare students for their dissertation in the final year.

title: Veterinary Nursing and Companion Animal Behaviour (BSc)
summary: The BSc Veterinary Nursing and Companion Animal Behaviour course at the University of Bristol combines practical nursing skills with in-depth knowledge of animal behaviour. It prepares students for a career in veterinary nursing, focusing on team-based healthcare and the well-being of animals. Graduates can apply directly to the RCVS Register of Veterinary Nurses and explore various career opportunities in clinical practice, animal charities, and the commercial sector.
requirements: A-levels: BBC including B in Biology; BTEC: DMM in Applied Science or Animal Management; International Baccalaureate: 29 points overall with 14 at Higher Level including 5 in Higher Level Biology; GCSE: Standard numeracy and literacy requirements.
structure: Year 1 focuses on comparative anatomy and veterinary nursing principles. Year 2 includes clinical veterinary nursing, anaesthesia, and animal behaviour. Year 3 involves clinical placements and assessments, while Year 4 covers applied clinical nursing and a research project.

title: Virology and Immunology with Study in Industry (BSc)
summary: The BSc Virology and Immunology with Study in Industry is a four-year degree that offers students the chance to gain practical experience in a commercial or research setting during their third year. This program is similar to the BSc Virology and Immunology but emphasizes industry placement. Students will transfer into this course after securing a placement, typically in a biotech or pharmaceutical company or a research institute.
requirements: Entry is by transfer from BSc Virology and Immunology (UCAS code C540). Applicants must meet typical offer criteria and may need to demonstrate English language proficiency through IELTS or GCSE English Language.
structure: The course spans four years, with the third year dedicated to industry placement. Specific course units and structure details can be found in the programme catalogue.

title: Virology and Immunology (BSc)
summary: The BSc in Virology and Immunology provides a comprehensive background in biomedical sciences, focusing on viruses and the immune system. Students will explore viral diseases, autoimmune conditions, and cutting-edge issues in virology and immunology, including emerging viruses. The course includes a research project in either virology or immunology and offers a four-year option with study in industry.

structure: Years one and two provide a broad background in biomedical sciences, while the third year focuses on major viral diseases and their biology, immunology, and epidemiology.

title: Zoology with a Professional Placement (BSc)
summary: The BSc Zoology with a Professional Placement course at the University of Bristol offers an interdisciplinary approach to animal biology, covering topics from molecular to ecological levels. This four-year program includes a third-year professional placement, allowing students to gain industry experience. The course begins with a broad foundation in zoology and provides more specialized choices in the later years.

title: Zoology (BSc)

Students can tailor their studies to their interests, with opportunities for fieldwork and practical research projects. The program emphasizes research and transferable skills to enhance employability.

structure: The course begins broadly in Year 1, with increasing specialization and options in Years 2 and 3, including a week-long field or laboratory-based course and a practical research project.

title: Gateway to Veterinary Science (BVSc)
summary: The Gateway to Veterinary Science course is designed for students who aspire to become veterinarians but do not meet the standard academic entry criteria for direct admission to the five-year Veterinary Science program. It focuses on core basic sciences and personal development, providing a supportive learning environment alongside peers from medical and dental disciplines. Successful completion of the Gateway year guarantees progression to the BVSc Veterinary Science course.

requirements.A-levels: BBC including B in Biology or Chemistry. Applicants with predicted or achieved grades of AAB or above are not eligible.
requirements.BTEC: DMM or DDM in Applied Science with specified Biology or Chemistry units. DDD or above cannot be considered.
requirements.International Baccalaureate: 29 points overall with 14 at Higher level, including 5 at Higher Level in Biology or Chemistry. 33 points overall with 16 at Higher Level or 6 in Chemistry are not eligible.
requirements.Scottish Qualifications Authority: BB in Advanced Higher including Biology or Chemistry, and BBBBC in Standard Level.
requirements.GCSE: Standard literacy (4 or C in GCSE English) and numeracy (4 or C in GCSE Mathematics) requirements.

structure: The course includes studies in basic cell biology, anatomy, physiology, biochemistry, chemistry principles, numeracy skills, clinical professional attributes, and practical placements. Successful students will then join the five-year BVSc Veterinary Science course.

title: Veterinary Science (BVSc)
summary: The BVSc Veterinary Science course at the University of Bristol offers a cutting-edge curriculum that emphasizes evidence-based teaching methods and hands-on experience with animals from the start. Students will engage in case-based learning, work alongside experts, and benefit from a dual campus experience. The program prepares graduates for diverse career opportunities in veterinary medicine, supported by strong industry partnerships and accreditations.
requirements: A-level standard offer: AAA including Chemistry and one of Biology, Physics, Mathematics or Further Mathematics. A-level contextual offer: ABB including AB in Chemistry and one of Biology, Physics, Mathematics or Further Mathematics. International Baccalaureate: 36 points overall with 18 at Higher Level, including 6 at Higher Level in Chemistry and one of Biology, Physics or Mathematics.
structure: Year 1 covers anatomy and physiology of body systems and handling of common species. Year 2 focuses on the body's response to disease and handling of pigs, poultry, and exotic pets. Year 3 emphasizes diagnosis and management of conditions, while Year 4 builds on advanced practical skills. Year 5 includes supervised core rotations in various workplace settings.

title: Veterinary Science: Accelerated Graduate Entry (BVSc)
summary: The BVSc Veterinary Science: Accelerated Graduate Entry program at the University of Bristol offers a fast-track route for graduates to obtain a veterinary science degree in four years. This rigorous course combines scientific knowledge with hands-on clinical training, preparing students for a successful career in veterinary medicine. The program is accredited by the AVMA and provides access to state-of-the-art facilities and a distinctive student-led learning approach.
requirements: Undergraduate bachelor's degree (first or 2:1 or equivalent) in a relevant science subject. No specific GCSE subjects required. English language requirements include IELTS 7.5 overall with 7.0 in all skills or GCSE English Language grade B or 6.
structure: Years 1 and 2 focus on case-based, tutor-facilitated small-group teaching, covering integrated structure and function of animals, principles of disease, and clinical veterinary science. Years 3 and 4 integrate with the final two and a half years of the five-year BVSc degree, emphasizing clinical skills and placements.

title: Biochemistry (MSci)
summary: The MSci Biochemistry course at the University of Bristol explores the molecular basis of life, enhancing understanding of human health and disease while supporting applied sciences like drug discovery and biotechnology. Students engage in groundbreaking research and develop high-level analytical and problem-solving skills, preparing them for diverse careers. The curriculum includes contemporary topics such as molecular genetics, immunology, and synthetic biology, with a strong emphasis on practical and research skills.

summary: The MSci Biochemistry with Medical Biochemistry course at the University of Bristol explores the molecular basis of life, focusing on human health and disease. It combines theoretical knowledge with practical research skills, preparing students for diverse careers in fields such as drug discovery and biotechnology. The course includes a significant research project and offers optional units relevant to medicine.

It covers a wide range of biological sciences, from enzymes to ecosystems, and allows students to specialize or maintain breadth in their studies. The fourth year includes advanced skills training and a substantial research project, preparing graduates for careers in biological sciences.

title: Biology with Professional Placement (MSci)
summary: The MSci Biology with Professional Placement is a five-year course designed for students aiming to pursue biological research and enhance their competitiveness for PhD programs or research jobs. It includes a third year dedicated to gaining industry experience, expanding on the standard MSci Biology curriculum. Students can apply for a professional placement after their first year based on academic performance.

title: Business and Management with Innovation (MSci)
summary: The MSci Business and Management with Innovation course at the University of Bristol prepares students to become innovative thinkers who can work across various disciplines. It combines business and management studies with interdisciplinary, practice-based learning, enabling students to develop critical, analytical, and creative skills. The course emphasizes group work and real-world applications, culminating in a portfolio of work and a network of peers and advisers.

summary: The MSci Cancer Biology and Immunology course at the University of Bristol is designed for students interested in research and pursuing a PhD or future employment in the field. The program covers the biology of normal and cancerous cells, the immune system, and various diseases, with practical teaching supported by a dynamic laboratory manual. Students will engage in research projects and skills training, focusing on translational research to prepare for a career in biomedical sciences.

title: Cellular and Molecular Medicine (MSci)
summary: The MSci in Cellular and Molecular Medicine at the University of Bristol is designed for students interested in research and pursuing a PhD or employment in the field. The course covers the cellular and molecular basis of human diseases, biochemistry, and genetics, with a strong emphasis on practical laboratory skills. The final year includes an extended research project and training in research skills with a focus on enterprise and translational research.

structure: Year 1 focuses on broad training in biomedical sciences and basic biochemistry. Year 2 includes molecular genetics and recombinant DNA technology. Year 3 offers options in cancer biology, stem cell biology, and immunology. The fourth year features an extended research project and skills training.

title: Foundation in Arts and Social Sciences (CertHE)
summary: The CertHE Foundation in Arts and Social Sciences is a one-year introductory course designed to prepare students for undergraduate degrees in arts or social sciences. It requires no prior qualifications and focuses on essential study skills. Students can choose between two pathways: Arts and Humanities or Social Sciences, and complete an Individual Project related to their intended degree.
requirements: No formal entry requirements; applications judged on merit. Priority may be given to applicants without prior higher education experience or QCA-level 3 qualifications. English language requirements include IELTS 6.5 overall with 6.0 in all skills or GCSE English Language grade C or 4.
structure: The course includes four compulsory units and one optional unit in both pathways. The Arts and Humanities pathway leads to degrees in Arts, Humanities, or Modern Languages, while the Social Sciences pathway leads to degrees in Education, Policy Studies, Sociology, Politics and International Studies, or Law.

title: Foundation in Science, Engineering and Mathematics (CertHE)
summary: The CertHE Foundation in Science, Engineering and Mathematics is a one-year introductory course designed to prepare students for undergraduate study in non-clinical science, engineering, or mathematics. It is tailored for those returning to education without recent Level 3 qualifications, providing support to transition to degree-level study. Successful completion guarantees a place in an undergraduate degree, depending on the chosen pathway and results.
requirements: No academic qualifications are required for entry. Applications are assessed based on personal statement and interview. Priority may be given to applicants without prior higher education experience or QCA-level 3 qualifications. Specific science A-levels taken in the last five years make applicants ineligible.
structure: The course comprises four units: a core laboratory science unit, a maths unit, a STEM skills unit, and a group research project unit. Students choose either a chemistry or physics pathway and take a core maths unit to build problem-solving skills.

title: Chemical Physics (MSci)
summary: The MSci Chemical Physics course at the University of Bristol is a four-year program that combines chemistry, physics, and mathematics, preparing students for scientific careers. It emphasizes interdisciplinary topics such as materials science and nanoscience, with a strong focus on practical labs and research projects. Graduates are well-equipped with experimental techniques and computational skills sought after by employers.

The first two years mirror the MSci Chemical Physics program, while the third year includes a paid placement in a company. The course emphasizes cross-disciplinary topics such as materials science and nanoscience, combining lectures, practical labs, and small-group tutorials.

title: Chemistry (MSci)
summary: The MSci Chemistry course at the University of Bristol is designed for students who wish to deepen their understanding of chemistry and tackle global challenges such as climate change and drug discovery. Guided by world-class experts, students will gain practical experience in state-of-the-art labs and work on significant research projects. The course prepares graduates for diverse career paths in science and offers pathways to postgraduate study.

title: Chemistry with Computing (MSci)
summary: The MSci Chemistry with Computing course at the University of Bristol combines the study of chemistry with advanced computing skills. It prepares students for careers in coding, scientific computing, and data analysis, addressing global challenges through a unique blend of theoretical and practical knowledge. Students will engage in projects that emphasize the application of computational methods in chemistry, culminating in an independent research project.

title: Chemistry with Industrial Experience (MSci)
summary: The MSci Chemistry with Industrial Experience at the University of Bristol offers students the opportunity to gain paid experience with leading employers while deepening their understanding of chemistry. The program prepares graduates for diverse career options, particularly in the chemical industry, by providing real-world expertise through an industrial placement. Students engage in significant research projects that address global challenges in chemistry.

requirements.BTEC: D*DD in Applied Science BTEC National Level 3 Extended Diploma with Distinctions in five required Chemistry units
requirements.International Baccalaureate: 38 points overall with 18 at Higher Level, including 6 at Higher Level in Chemistry
requirements.Scottish Qualifications Authority: Advanced Higher: AA including Chemistry, and Standard Higher: AAAAA

structure: In the first two years, students study alongside other chemistry students with tailored course choices. The third year is dedicated to an industrial placement, and the final year includes a 20-week research project with an academic staff member.

title: Chemistry with Study Abroad (MSci)
summary: The MSci Chemistry with Study Abroad course at the University of Bristol allows students to deepen their understanding of chemistry while gaining international experience by studying abroad in their third year. Guided by world-class experts, students will tackle significant global challenges in chemistry, such as climate change and drug discovery. The program culminates in a final year research project, enhancing practical skills and knowledge.

requirements.BTEC: D*DD in Applied Science BTEC National Level 3 Extended Diploma

structure: In Year 1 and Year 2, students study alongside other chemistry students with options to tailor their degree. Year 3 is spent studying abroad at an English-speaking university, and the final year includes a 20-week research project.

title: Chemistry with Study Abroad in a Modern Language (MSci)
summary: The MSci Chemistry with Study Abroad in a Modern Language course at the University of Bristol allows students to deepen their understanding of chemistry while studying in a foreign language during their third year. Students will spend their third year at a European university and engage in research projects addressing significant challenges in chemistry. The program is designed for those looking to broaden their academic and cultural experiences.

requirements.BTEC: D*DD in Applied Science BTEC National Level 3 Extended Diploma

title: Civil Engineering (MEng)
summary: The MEng Civil Engineering course at the University of Bristol prepares students to tackle global environmental challenges and design sustainable infrastructure. It combines theoretical knowledge with practical application, emphasizing design through projects and real-world challenges. Students will develop key skills in project management, entrepreneurship, and risk analysis, while benefiting from world-class facilities and industry links.

requirements.A-level standard offer: A*AA including A*A in Mathematics and a science-related subject.
requirements.A-level contextual offer: AAB including AA in Mathematics and a science-related subject.
requirements.BTEC: D*DD in Engineering BTEC National Level 3 Extended Diploma plus A in Mathematics at A-level.
requirements.International Baccalaureate: 38 points overall with 18 at Higher Level, including 7, 6 in Mathematics and a science-related subject.
requirements.English language requirements: IELTS 6.5 overall with 6.0 in all skills or GCSE English Language grade C or 4.

structure: Year 1 focuses on foundational engineering principles, including mathematics and surveying. Year 2 includes design with materials like steel and concrete, and water engineering. Year 3 involves a major individual research project, while Year 4 allows for specialization through elective units and a group design project.

title: Civil Engineering with Study Abroad (MEng)
summary: The MEng Civil Engineering with Study Abroad program at the University of Bristol equips students with the skills to tackle global environmental challenges and design sustainable infrastructure. The course combines theoretical knowledge with practical application, including a year of study abroad at a partner university. Students will engage in design projects and interdisciplinary work, preparing them for a successful career in civil engineering.
requirements: This course is available by transfer only. No specific GCSE subjects are required. For English language, an IELTS score of 6.5 overall with 6.0 in all skills, or GCSE English Language grade C or 4 is needed.
structure: Year 1 focuses on foundational engineering principles, including mathematics and design projects. Year 2 includes designing with materials like steel and concrete, while optional units are introduced in later years. The third year is spent studying abroad, and the final year involves a group design project.

title: Civil Engineering with a Year in Industry (MEng)
summary: The MEng Civil Engineering with a Year in Industry program at the University of Bristol prepares students to tackle global environmental challenges and design critical infrastructure. The course combines theoretical knowledge with practical application, including a year-long industry placement. Students will engage in design projects and develop essential skills for a successful career in civil engineering.
requirements: Transfer only from BEng Civil Engineering (UCAS code H205), MEng Civil Engineering (H200), or MEng Civil Engineering with Study Abroad in a Modern Language (H201). English language requirements include IELTS 6.5 overall with 6.0 in all skills or GCSE English Language grade C or 4.
structure: Year 1 focuses on foundational engineering principles, while Year 2 includes design with materials like steel and concrete, geotechnical design, and water engineering. The third year is a placement in industry, and the final year allows for specialization through elective units and a group design project.

title: Computer Science (MEng)
summary: The MEng Computer Science course at the University of Bristol provides a comprehensive foundation in computer science principles, with opportunities to specialize in advanced topics in later years. Students will engage in team projects and individual research, focusing on real-world applications and industry demands. The curriculum is regularly updated to reflect the latest developments in digital technology.

requirements.BTEC: D*DD in Engineering BTEC National Level 3 Extended Diploma plus A in Mathematics at A-level, or any Applied General BTEC National Level 3 Extended Diploma plus A in Mathematics at A-level.
requirements.International Baccalaureate: 38 points overall with 18 at Higher Level, including 7 at Higher Level in Mathematics.

structure: Year 1 focuses on core computer science principles, Year 2 includes a software team project, Year 3 involves a significant team project on complex applications, and Year 4 features an individual project with opportunities for collaboration with industry or research partners.

title: Computer Science with Artificial Intelligence (MEng)
summary: The MEng Computer Science with Artificial Intelligence program combines a focus on the rapidly evolving field of AI with a solid foundation in computer science. Students will learn algorithms, programming, and core AI concepts while engaging in team projects and individual research. The curriculum is designed to remain at the forefront of technology, preparing graduates for advanced roles in the industry.

Students will engage in core concepts of algorithms, programming, and AI, while also participating in a team project to develop an AI application for a real-world client. The course includes a year abroad to study parallel topics and culminates in a specialized fourth year with an individual AI project.
requirements: The course accepts a wide variety of qualifications, including A-levels and international qualifications. Specific GCSE profile requirements and English language requirements are to be confirmed.
structure: Year 1 focuses on core principles of algorithms and programming. Year 2 includes an AI software team project and further study of AI concepts. The final year allows for specialization in advanced areas of computer science and AI, culminating in an individual project.

title: Computer Science with Innovation (MEng)
summary: The MEng Computer Science with Innovation course at the University of Bristol combines in-depth computer science studies with interdisciplinary, practice-based learning. Students will work collaboratively across various disciplines to develop innovative solutions and entrepreneurial ventures. The course emphasizes group work and personal development, preparing graduates to influence the future of technology and society.

The course includes a broad first year followed by specialized design methodology and professional practice, culminating in a group-based design project in the final year.

Successful completion of the Gateway year guarantees progression to the five-year MB ChB Medicine course.

title: International Foundation Programme (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics)
summary: The International Foundation Programme in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics at the University of Bristol prepares students for undergraduate study through immersive learning in small classroom environments. Students engage in laboratory work and develop academic communication skills tailored to STEM disciplines, while receiving support from personal tutors. The programme also includes research themes relevant to students' interests, enhancing their understanding of academic life and future career paths.
requirements: Applicants should have a minimum of three A-levels at grade C, five GCSEs at grade B, or equivalent qualifications. A minimum GCSE grade B or equivalent in Mathematics and a Science subject is required. International students must meet specific academic entry requirements based on their country.

Students aiming for life, health, and geographical sciences will focus on biomedical sciences and research skills.

title: International Foundation Programme for Dentistry
summary: The International Foundation Programme (IFP) for Dentistry is a one-year course designed for overseas students aiming to enter dental degree programmes in the UK. It provides an alternative pathway for students needing additional study to meet the qualifications and skills required for dental degrees. Successful completion guarantees an interview for the BDS programme at the University of Bristol.
requirements: Graduation from year 12 of high school with a good GPA, including strong grades in sciences, particularly Chemistry. English language requirements to be confirmed.
structure: The programme consists of four mandatory level three units: Foundations of Chemistry, Foundations in Biomedical Sciences, Personal and Professional Development for Aspiring Clinicians, and English Language and Academic Skills for Aspiring Clinicians.

title: Law and Modern Languages (LLB)
summary: The LLB in Law and Modern Languages at the University of Bristol offers a comprehensive legal education combined with the study of a modern language and its culture. This four-year joint honours course allows students to explore English law alongside French, German, or Spanish, culminating in a year abroad at a partner university. Graduates will develop advanced language skills and a deep understanding of different legal systems, preparing them for a globalized legal career.

Year 2 includes core areas of English, European, and Comparative law, with opportunities to develop linguistic skills. Year 3 is spent abroad studying law in the chosen language, and Year 4 offers optional units and an Independent Research Project.

title: Law with Study Abroad (LLB)
summary: The LLB Law with Study Abroad program at the University of Bristol offers a comprehensive legal education with the opportunity to study abroad for a year. Students will gain a solid foundation in legal knowledge while exploring various legal topics, and will be taught by leading academics in a vibrant city. The program prepares students for the Bar Practice Course or the Solicitors Qualifying Examination (SQE), enhancing their employability in a globalized workplace.
requirements: Typical offers include a variety of qualifications, and applicants must meet GCSE profile requirements. English language proficiency is required, with options including IELTS 7.0 or GCSE English Language grade B. Additionally, applicants must sit the LNAT.
structure: Year 1 focuses on developing key legal skills in research and analysis. Year 2 allows for deeper legal knowledge, while Year 3 is spent studying abroad. The final year includes optional units and an Independent Research Project.
careers: Qualifying Work Experience (QWE) through law clinics

title: Law with Study in Continental Europe (LLB)
summary: The LLB Law with Study in Continental Europe offers a comprehensive foundation in legal knowledge while allowing students to study abroad for a year in various European countries. This program is designed to enhance understanding of different legal systems and cultures, preparing graduates for a globalized legal career. Students will benefit from world-class teaching and gain practical experience through law clinics and career support.
requirements: Typical offers include a variety of qualifications, and applicants must sit the LNAT. English language requirements include IELTS 7.0 overall with 7.0 in writing and 6.5 in all other skills, or GCSE English Language grade B or 6.
structure: Year 1 focuses on developing key legal skills in research and analysis. Year 2 allows for deeper exploration of legal themes, while Year 3 is spent studying abroad. The final year includes optional units and an Independent Research Project.
careers: Qualifying Work Experience (QWE) through law clinics

title: Law (LLB)

Taught by world-leading academics, the curriculum is research-rich and prepares students for prestigious careers in both law and non-law sectors. Students can gain practical experience through law clinics and receive career development support.

Students will develop critical skills in analysis and communication, with the opportunity to study abroad in their third year. The course culminates in a master's-level dissertation and advanced units in the final year.

Students will develop innovative solutions by collaborating with peers from various disciplines, enhancing their skills in musicology, composition, and performance. The program emphasizes group work and personal development, preparing graduates for a range of creative and entrepreneurial ventures.

The program includes opportunities for fieldwork and studying abroad at partner universities, enhancing students' global perspectives. Graduates are prepared for various careers in fields such as journalism, law, politics, and education.

The course emphasizes personal development and entrepreneurial skills, culminating in a portfolio of work and a network of industry contacts.

title: Medicine (MB ChB)
summary: The MB ChB Medicine course at the University of Bristol is the primary medical qualification recognized by the General Medical Council. It combines early clinical exposure, a blend of lectures and practical work, and a substantial student choice program to prepare students for a career in medicine. The course emphasizes inter-professional working and offers a final year designed to prepare students for their first job as foundation doctors.
requirements: A-level standard offer: AAA including Chemistry and either Biology, Physics, Mathematics or Further Mathematics. A-level contextual offer: ABB including A in Chemistry and B in one of Biology, Physics, Mathematics or Further Mathematics. International Baccalaureate: 36 points overall with 18 at Higher Level, including 6, 6 at Higher Level in Chemistry and one of Biology, Physics or Mathematics.
structure: Year 1 focuses on health and wellbeing through case-based learning and clinical placements. Year 2 explores disease processes and differential diagnoses. Year 3 involves working in primary, community, and secondary care settings. Year 4 covers patient care across the life course, and Year 5 prepares students for Foundation Programme posts.

title: Mathematics and Computer Science (MEng)
summary: The MEng Mathematics and Computer Science course at the University of Bristol combines rigorous training in mathematics with an understanding of computer science and its applications. This four-year program prepares students for diverse fields such as high finance, cryptography, quantum computing, algorithm design, machine learning, and data science. It emphasizes both theoretical and practical skills essential for solving modern problems.

requirements.A-level standard offer: A*A*A including A* in Mathematics and A in another mathematics-related subject.
requirements.A-level contextual offer: AAA including Mathematics and another mathematics-related subject.
requirements.International Baccalaureate: 40 points overall with 18 at Higher Level, including 7 at Higher Level in Mathematics.
requirements.BTEC: D*D*D in Engineering BTEC National Level 3 Extended Diploma plus A in Mathematics at A-level.

structure: In Year 1 and Year 2, students study essential core components of mathematics and computer science. In subsequent years, they can tailor their options to balance theoretical and practical skills.

title: Mechanical Engineering with Study Abroad (MEng)
summary: The MEng Mechanical Engineering with Study Abroad course at the University of Bristol is designed to educate future mechanical engineers with a strong foundation in engineering science and practice. It covers key areas such as design, dynamics, materials, and energy flow, while providing an opportunity to study abroad in an English-speaking environment during the third year. The course emphasizes interdisciplinary collaboration and includes a substantial group project in the final year.
requirements: This course is available by transfer only from BEng Mechanical Engineering (UCAS code H305), MEng Mechanical Engineering (H300), or MEng Mechanical Engineering with Study Abroad in a Modern Language (H301). English language requirements include IELTS 6.5 overall with 6.0 in all skills or GCSE English Language grade C or 4.
structure: Year 1 focuses on fundamental engineering principles with common units shared among various engineering disciplines. Year 2 continues with core mechanical engineering topics, while Year 3 involves studying abroad. In Year 4, students select specialist options and undertake a group project.

title: Mechanical Engineering with a Year in Industry (MEng)
summary: The MEng Mechanical Engineering with a Year in Industry is a five-year course designed to equip students with a comprehensive understanding of engineering science and practice. It covers essential areas such as design, dynamics, materials, and energy flow, with a strong emphasis on practical experience through an industrial placement in the third year. The curriculum fosters independent research and teamwork, preparing graduates for impactful careers in mechanical engineering.
requirements: This course is available by transfer only from specific mechanical engineering courses. Applicants must meet GCSE profile requirements and English language requirements, including IELTS 6.5 overall with 6.0 in all skills or equivalent.
structure: Year 1 focuses on fundamental engineering principles, while Year 2 includes common units with peers from other engineering disciplines. Year 3 involves an industrial placement, Year 4 emphasizes real-world applications through research projects, and Year 5 allows for specialization and group projects.

title: Mechanical Engineering (MEng)
summary: The MEng Mechanical Engineering course at the University of Bristol is designed to educate future mechanical engineers with a balanced curriculum that covers engineering science and practice. It emphasizes professional skills in design, dynamics, materials, and energy flow, with a focus on real-world applications through projects and research. Students will engage in interdisciplinary work and develop a strong foundation in engineering principles during their first two years.

The course includes a third year spent in industry, allowing students to apply their knowledge in a practical setting. In the final year, students work on a team project related to engineering challenges, enhancing their problem-solving skills.
requirements: This course is available by transfer only from BEng or MEng Mechanical and Electrical Engineering. English language requirements include IELTS 6.5 overall with 6.0 in all skills or GCSE English Language grade C or 4.

It covers themes such as electro-mechanical systems, energy conversion, and embedded systems. The program emphasizes interdisciplinary learning and includes practical projects and research opportunities in later years.

Students will develop skills in both disciplines, exploring topics such as logic, ethics, and the philosophy of science. The course culminates in a fourth year that allows for in-depth study and research alongside postgraduate students.

title: Mathematics and Physics (MSci)
summary: The MSci Mathematics and Physics course at the University of Bristol is a four-year, joint-honours program that combines the study of applied mathematics with physics. Students will explore mathematical modeling, quantum information theory, and various physics topics, including special relativity and electromagnetism. The course offers a balanced exploration in the first two years, followed by specialized units in the later years, culminating in a research project.

The four-year program includes opportunities for project work and collaboration with faculty, allowing students to tailor their studies to their interests. The curriculum covers statistical computing, Bayesian estimation, and hypothesis testing, preparing graduates for various career paths.

Students benefit from passionate lecturers and the opportunity for project work in their final year, supported by a strong academic framework.

The program includes practical laboratory sessions, research projects, and an extended research project in the fourth year.

Students will study core pharmacology units and have the opportunity to explore various related subjects, preparing them for careers in research and further academic pursuits.

title: Physics with Industrial Experience (MSci)
summary: The MSci Physics with Industrial Experience course at the University of Bristol offers students a comprehensive education in physics, combined with a year of hands-on paid experience in industry. This program emphasizes the development of practical skills in project management, teamwork, and communication, while exploring fundamental concepts in physics from particle physics to cosmology. Graduates are well-prepared for careers in research or industry, benefiting from the university's strong reputation in physics education and research.

requirements.A-level standard offer: A*AA including A*A in Mathematics and Physics
requirements.A-level contextual offer: AAB including AA in Mathematics and Physics
requirements.BTEC: D*DD in Engineering BTEC National Level 3 Extended Diploma with Distinctions in four specified Physics units, and A in Mathematics at A-level

requirements.European Baccalaureate: 88% overall, with 9.0, 8.5 in Mathematics and Physics
requirements.Scottish Qualifications Authority: Advanced Higher: AA in Mathematics and Physics, and Standard Higher: AAAAA
requirements.Access to HE Diploma: Access to HE Diploma in Engineering, Science, or Computing with specific credit requirements
requirements.English language requirements: IELTS 6.5 overall with 6.0 in all skills or GCSE English Language grade C or 4

structure: Year 1 provides a grounding in physics and mathematics, while Year 2 focuses on fundamental physics principles and laboratory work. During the year in industry, students continue core physics studies via distance learning, leading to a major project in the final year.

title: Physics with Innovation (MSci)
summary: The MSci Physics with Innovation course at the University of Bristol combines in-depth physics studies with interdisciplinary, practice-based learning in innovation and entrepreneurship. Students will develop critical skills in physics while working collaboratively on innovative solutions across various disciplines. The course prepares graduates for a range of careers by equipping them with a portfolio of work and a network of peers and advisers.

title: Physics with International Experience (MSci)
summary: The MSci Physics with International Experience course combines in-depth training in physics with the opportunity to live and study abroad for a year. Students will engage in research projects at partner universities while continuing their studies through distance learning. The program culminates in a major project in the final year, addressing cutting-edge research questions.

title: Physics with Study Abroad in a Modern Language (MSci)
summary: The MSci Physics with Study Abroad in a Modern Language course at the University of Bristol offers a comprehensive grounding in physics and mathematics, with a unique opportunity to study abroad in Europe during the third year. Students will engage in practical laboratory work and computational physics while also learning a modern language. The final year includes a major project in a research group, allowing students to apply their knowledge in advanced research-led contexts.

title: Physics (MSci)
summary: The MSci Physics course at the University of Bristol focuses on the fundamental building blocks and forces of nature, exploring topics from quantum physics to the cosmos. It offers advanced research-led material in the final year, allowing students to develop originality and advanced problem-solving techniques. The course emphasizes flexibility and choice, enabling students to specialize in areas of interest while gaining a broad range of experimental, theoretical, and analytical skills.

title: Physiological Science (MSci)
summary: The MSci Physiological Science course emphasizes an extended research project, allowing students to gain in-depth research skills in a specialized area. The first three years cover the major organ systems and complementary subjects like pharmacology and psychology, while the fourth year focuses on research and public engagement. Graduates are well-prepared for careers in research, education, healthcare, and management.

requirements.A-level: AAB including two core science/mathematics subjects.
requirements.BTEC: DDD in Applied Science BTEC National Level 3 Extended Diploma.

structure: Year 1 focuses on major organ systems and complementary subjects. Year 2 continues with physiology and related fields. Year 3 delves into cutting-edge research topics, while Year 4 centers on an extended research project and public engagement activities.

title: Plant Sciences with Professional Placement (MSci)
summary: The MSci in Plant Sciences with Professional Placement is designed for students aiming to pursue plant science research, providing them with additional industry experience during their third year. This five-year course enhances the standard MSci Plant Sciences program, allowing students to gain a competitive edge for PhD applications and research positions.

requirements.A-level contextual offer: ABB including AB in two science-related subjects
requirements.BTEC: DDD in Applied Science or Animal Management
requirements.International Baccalaureate: 36 points overall with 18 at Higher Level, including 6, 6 in two science-related subjects

structure: The course spans five years, with the third year dedicated to gaining industry experience. The first two years cover foundational plant science topics, while later years allow for specialization and practical application.

title: Plant Sciences (MSci)
summary: The MSci in Plant Sciences at the University of Bristol offers an in-depth exploration of plant biology, covering topics from enzymes to ecosystems. Students will gain knowledge in areas such as functional genomics, ecology, and plant conservation, with opportunities for practical research projects. The course is designed for those aiming to pursue further research in plant sciences.

requirements.A-level: AAA including Biology and another science-related subject.
requirements.A-level contextual: ABB including AB in Biology and another science-related subject.
requirements.BTEC: DDD in Applied Science BTEC National Level 3 Extended Diploma with Distinctions in five required Biology units.
requirements.International Baccalaureate: 36 points overall with 18 at Higher Level, including 6, 6 at Higher Level in Biology and another science-related subject.
requirements.European Baccalaureate: 85% overall, with 8.5 in Biology and another science-related subject.

structure: The course starts broadly in Year 1, with more specialized choices in Years 2 and 3, including a week-long field or laboratory unit and a ten-week practical research project.

title: Psychology and Neuroscience (MSci)
summary: The MSci Psychology and Neuroscience course at the University of Bristol combines critical theoretical and practical skills in psychology with an understanding of brain function from neuroscience. It emphasizes empirical study of the nervous system, mind, and behavior, preparing students for careers in psychology and related fields. The course is taught by experts and includes a variety of teaching methods and assessment formats.

requirements.A-level standard offer: A*AA including two core science/maths subjects.
requirements.A-level contextual offer: AAB including AB in two core science/maths subjects.
requirements.International Baccalaureate: 38 points overall with 18 at Higher Level, including 6, 6 at Higher Level in two core science/maths subjects.
requirements.BTEC: D*DD in Applied Science BTEC National Level 3 Extended Diploma.

structure: Year 1 introduces psychology and neuroanatomy, Year 2 focuses on biological, cognitive, social, and developmental psychology, and Year 3 emphasizes research design and analysis with opportunities to specialize in areas like neurological disorders.

title: Psychology with Innovation (MSci)
summary: The MSci Psychology with Innovation course at the University of Bristol combines in-depth psychology studies with interdisciplinary, practice-based learning. Students will develop innovative solutions by applying psychological theories to real-world challenges, working collaboratively with peers from various disciplines. The program emphasizes group work, personal development, and entrepreneurial skills, preparing graduates for careers in psychology and innovation.

title: Theoretical Physics (MSci)
summary: The MSci in Theoretical Physics at the University of Bristol focuses on understanding and predicting physical phenomena through conceptual and mathematical frameworks. The course begins with a foundation in physics before emphasizing theoretical methods in later years. Students will engage with advanced research-led material and develop a broad range of skills applicable in both research and industry.

title: Virology and Immunology (MSci)
summary: The MSci in Virology and Immunology at the University of Bristol is designed for students interested in research and advanced studies in biomedical sciences. The course covers the immune system, viral diseases, and cutting-edge issues in virology and immunology. The fourth year includes an extended research project and skills training focused on enterprise and commercialization.

requirements.A-levels: AAB including Chemistry and another core science/mathematics subject.
requirements.BTEC: DDD in Applied Science BTEC National Level 3 Extended Diploma with Distinctions in five required Chemistry units.

structure: Years 1 and 2 provide a broad background in biomedical sciences, focusing on viruses and the immune system. The fourth year includes an extended research project and training in research skills.

title: Zoology with a Professional Placement (MSci)
summary: The MSci Zoology with a Professional Placement course is designed for students aiming to pursue zoological research, providing additional industry experience to enhance their competitiveness for PhD programs and research positions. This five-year program includes a third year dedicated to gaining practical experience in the field. Students can apply for a professional placement after joining the course, based on their first-year results.
