structure: The course spans five years, with the first two years focusing on foundational zoology and biological sciences. The third year is dedicated to a professional placement, while the final two years involve advanced study and research projects.

title: Zoology (MSci)
summary: The MSci Zoology course at the University of Bristol is designed for students aiming to pursue zoological research, providing advanced skills training and a substantial research project in the fourth year. The program covers a broad range of animal biology, allowing students to tailor their studies to their interests while enhancing employability through research and transferable skills. The course is supported by state-of-the-art facilities and a world-class reputation in animal behaviour research.

requirements.A-level standard offer: AAA including Biology and another science-related subject.
requirements.A-level contextual offer: ABB including AB in Biology and another science-related subject.
requirements.BTEC: DDD in Applied Science BTEC National Level 3 Extended Diploma, with Distinctions in five required Biology units.
requirements.International Baccalaureate: 36 points overall with 18 at Higher Level, including 6, 6 at Higher Level in Biology and another science-related subject.
requirements.English language requirements: IELTS 6.5 overall with 6.0 in all skills or GCSE English Language grade C or 4.

structure: The course begins broadly in Year 1, with increasing specialization and options in Years 2 and 3. The fourth year focuses on advanced skills training and a substantial research project.

title: Accounting and Finance
summary: The PhD in Accounting and Finance at the University of Bristol Business School emphasizes research with practical relevance, encouraging interdisciplinary approaches. Students will engage in a vibrant PhD community, participate in workshops, and complete taught units in their first year. The program is designed to prepare graduates for careers in research, consultancy, or policy-based institutions.
requirements: Applicants must have an upper second-class honours degree in a relevant subject or equivalent, and either have completed or be completing a master's qualification with a minimum Merit, ideally a Distinction in the research component. Exceptional candidates with excellent undergraduate qualifications may be considered without a master's.
structure: PhD students are required to complete 60 credits of taught units within the first 18 months, typically during the first year, and may need to undertake additional credits if funded by ESRC/SWDTP.

title: Advanced Composites
summary: The PhD in Advanced Composites is a four-year postgraduate research programme that combines an industry-relevant research project with a taught curriculum in composite materials, design, mechanics, and business skills. It aims to equip graduates with the technical and leadership skills necessary for the sustainable composites sector, addressing the growing demand for lightweight structures in various industries. The programme is run by the Centre for Doctoral Training in Innovation for Sustainable Composites Engineering, in collaboration with the Bristol Composites Institute and the University of Nottingham.
requirements: Applicants must hold a minimum 2:1 MEng or merit at master's level in engineering, physics, or chemistry. Those without a master's may be considered with a first-class undergraduate degree. Evidence of readiness for research is also required.
structure: Year 1 focuses on the fundamentals of composite materials, manufacturing, and mechanics, including sustainability. Year 2 includes professional development in innovation and business skills, while Year 3 offers a Technology Transfer in Practice unit for broader societal impact.

title: Advanced Quantitative Methods
summary: The Advanced Quantitative Methods (AQM) pathway is designed to advance quantitative methodologies in the social sciences, focusing on methodological innovation and application. It supports research that employs sophisticated statistical, mathematical, econometric, and computational modeling techniques, including machine learning and artificial intelligence. The program encourages the development of novel statistical methods for analyzing social science data.
requirements: At least a 2:1 in a relevant subject, or a master's qualification, or be working towards a master's qualification, or international equivalent in a relevant field.
structure: There are no taught elements to the PhD, but if funded by ESRC SWDTP, there may be additional requirements including taught modules in the first year.

title: Aerosol Science
summary: The PhD in Aerosol Science at the University of Bristol focuses on the study of airborne particles and their impact on health, climate, and material engineering. The program combines multidisciplinary training with research opportunities, including placements in industrial settings. It aims to equip graduates with the expertise to address challenges related to aerosols in various fields.
requirements: Applicants must hold a minimum of an upper second-class MSci honours degree in a relevant discipline or a postgraduate MSc. Lower second-class degrees may be considered with demonstrated research potential.
structure: Year 1 includes cohort-based training in aerosol science, covering core topics and computational tools, followed by a three-month research project. Years 2 and 3 involve PhD research and additional training through summer schools and events.

title: Aerospace Engineering
summary: The Aerospace Engineering program at the University of Bristol focuses on experimental, numerical, theoretical, and computational research applied to aerospace-related problems. It encompasses key areas such as Fluid Flow and Aerodynamics, Dynamics and Control, and Robotics, supported by a strong academic and research staff. Postgraduates are expected to publish in high-quality journals and present at international conferences, fostering independent and self-motivated research.
requirements: PhD applicants must hold a minimum of upper second class MEng/MSci (or equivalent) or a merit at postgraduate master's degree in a relevant discipline. MSc by Research applicants need an upper second class honours degree (or international equivalent) in science, mathematics, or engineering.
structure: MScR: up to two years full-time; up to four years part-time. PhD: up to four years full-time; up to eight years part-time.

title: Anthropology and Archaeology
summary: The Anthropology and Archaeology program at the University of Bristol offers a comprehensive research experience through an international 'four-field' approach, integrating archaeology with evolutionary, social, and linguistic anthropology. The program emphasizes understanding cultural, biological, and social diversity and change, focusing on themes such as adaptation, adversity, and globalization. Students engage in field research across various global locations and have access to world-class facilities and collaborative opportunities.
requirements: MPhil: A mid-level upper second-class degree or international equivalent with evidence of first-class research. PhD: A master's qualification or working towards one, or international equivalent, with evidence of first-class/distinction-level research. Exceptional cases may be considered for applicants with a first-class undergraduate degree.
structure: MPhil: One-year full-time research degree culminating in a 25,000-word dissertation. PhD: Research project over four years (full-time) culminating in an 80,000-word thesis, with options to audit taught units and potential teaching opportunities from the second year.

title: Biochemistry
summary: The Biochemistry program at the University of Bristol offers both PhD and MSc by Research degrees, focusing on training the next generation of life scientists through extensive research training and access to world-class facilities. Students engage in independent research supported by supervisors, with opportunities for skills training and collaboration. The program emphasizes critical interpretation, problem-solving, and transferable skills essential for a career in life sciences.
requirements: A first or upper second-class honours degree (or international equivalent) in a biomedical science or related discipline is required for entry to the PhD program. MSc by research applications may be considered from candidates with a lower second-class degree.
structure: The PhD program consists mainly of independent research supported by a primary supervisor, with annual progression monitoring and examination through a written thesis and viva voce. The MScR typically involves a year of independent research with similar monitoring and examination processes.
careers: Postdoctoral researchers in academia and industry

title: Biological Sciences
summary: The Biological Sciences program at the University of Bristol offers PhD and MSc by research opportunities across various biological disciplines, including genomics, biotechnology, and ecology. The program emphasizes cutting-edge research and provides a supportive environment for postgraduate students to develop their skills and careers. Students are encouraged to engage with academic supervisors and contribute to vital research.
requirements: An upper second-class honours degree (or equivalent) in biological sciences or a related discipline. English language requirements apply for non-native speakers.
structure: MScR: up to two years full-time; up to four years part-time. PhD: up to four years full-time; up to eight years part-time.

title: Cellular and Molecular Medicine
summary: The Cellular and Molecular Medicine program at the University of Bristol offers advanced study in cancer biology, infection and immunology, and regenerative medicine. It combines basic research with a focus on translating scientific discoveries into clinically useful applications. The program provides access to state-of-the-art facilities and a variety of research projects for MSc by Research students.
requirements: A first or upper second-class honours degree (or international equivalent) in a biomedical science discipline is required for entry to the PhD program. MSc by research applications may be considered from candidates with a lower second-class degree. Applicants for the MD should be medically qualified.
structure: MScR: up to two years full-time; PhD: up to four years full-time; MD: up to five years full-time.

title: Chemistry
summary: The School of Chemistry at the University of Bristol offers a world-class environment for PhD and MSc by research degrees, focusing on cutting-edge research and extensive collaborations with industry. With state-of-the-art facilities and support from leading academic supervisors, students engage in a wide range of research themes. The program emphasizes skill development in both chemistry and transferable skills for future careers.
requirements: A minimum of an upper second-class MSci/MChem honours degree in chemistry or a relevant related discipline, or a postgraduate MSc or international equivalent. Applicants with a lower second-class degree or a first/upper second-class BSc may be considered if they demonstrate good potential for research.
structure: MScR in Chemistry: up to two years full-time; up to four years part-time. PhD: up to four years full-time; up to eight years part-time.

title: Civil Engineering
summary: The Civil Engineering program at the University of Bristol focuses on multidisciplinary research aimed at ensuring the sustainable performance of infrastructure systems. It addresses challenges posed by natural and human hazards through extensive numerical and experimental investigations. The program offers both PhD and MSc by research opportunities, emphasizing collaboration with academic and industrial partners worldwide.
requirements: PhD applicants must hold a minimum of upper second class MEng/MSci (or equivalent) or a merit at postgraduate master's degree level in a relevant discipline. MSc by research applicants must have an upper second class honours degree (or international equivalent) in a relevant discipline.
structure: MScR: up to two years full-time; up to four years part-time. PhD: up to four years full-time; up to eight years part-time.

title: Classics and Ancient History
summary: The Classics and Ancient History program at the University of Bristol offers MPhil and PhD degrees, focusing on innovative research in reception studies and interdisciplinary approaches to antiquity. Students become part of a dynamic research community and can study via distance learning or on-campus. The program emphasizes independent research culminating in a dissertation or thesis, with opportunities for training and teaching experience.

requirements.MPhil: An upper second-class degree or international equivalent, with evidence of readiness for research.
requirements.PhD: A master's qualification or working towards one, or international equivalent. Exceptional cases may be considered for first-class undergraduate degree holders.

structure: MPhil is a one-year full-time research degree culminating in a 25,000-word dissertation. PhD involves a research project over four years, culminating in an 80,000-word thesis, with options to audit taught units and gain teaching experience from the second year.
careers: Research projects in classics and ancient history

title: Comparative Literatures and Cultures
summary: The Comparative Literatures and Cultures program at the University of Bristol focuses on transnational studies and intermediality, exploring cultural differences, interconnectedness, and innovative methodologies. It encourages interdisciplinary research across the arts and social sciences, addressing global issues such as mental health and climate change. Students benefit from a supportive community and are integrated into various research events and conferences.

requirements.MPhil: An upper second-class degree or international equivalent.
requirements.PhD: A master's qualification or working towards one, or international equivalent. Exceptional cases may be considered for first-class undergraduate degree holders.

structure.MPhil: One-year full-time research degree culminating in a 25,000-word dissertation.
structure.PhD: Research project over four years (minimum three years), culminating in an 80,000-word thesis, with options to audit taught units and potential teaching opportunities from the second year.

title: Composites Manufacture
summary: The Engineering Doctorate (EngD) in Composites Manufacture is a four-year postgraduate research programme that combines an industry-based research project with a taught curriculum in composites materials, design, mechanics, and business skills. It aims to equip graduates with advanced technical and leadership skills necessary for the composites sector, which is rapidly growing due to global demand for sustainable materials. Students spend 75% of their time in industry, working closely with their sponsor companies.
requirements: Applicants must hold a minimum 2:1 MEng or merit at master's level in engineering, physics, or chemistry. Those without a master's may be considered if they have a first-class undergraduate degree. Evidence of readiness for research is also required.
structure: Year 1 focuses on the fundamentals of composite materials, manufacturing, and mechanics, including sustainability. Year 2 covers innovation, business skills, and design for manufacture. Year 3 includes a Technology Transfer in Practice unit for broader societal impact reflection.

title: Computer Science
summary: The Computer Science program at the University of Bristol offers PhD and MSc by research degrees, focusing on intelligent systems, digital media, and the foundations of computing. The program is supported by strong industry connections and aims to prepare students for both academic and commercial careers in high-technology sectors. Located in the Merchant Venturers Building, it emphasizes collaborative research and innovation.
requirements: PhD applicants must hold a minimum of a merit at master's degree level (or international equivalent) in a relevant discipline. MSc by Research applicants need an upper second class honours degree (or international equivalent) in a relevant discipline.
structure: The program duration is up to four years full-time or eight years part-time, with a focus on research from the outset.
careers: Academic careers in world-class research groups

title: Creative Writing
summary: The Creative Writing program at the University of Bristol offers postgraduate research qualifications (MPhil and PhD) focused on producing an original body of work, typically a novel or a collection of poetry/short stories, accompanied by a critical element. The program emphasizes the interplay between creative and critical practices, aiming to contribute significantly to current literary discourses.

requirements.MPhil: An upper second-class degree or international equivalent, with evidence of readiness for research in Creative Writing.
requirements.PhD: A master's qualification or working towards one, or international equivalent. Exceptional cases may be considered for first-class undergraduate degree holders.

structure: MPhil is a one-year full-time program culminating in a 25,000-word dissertation, while the PhD spans up to four years full-time, ending with an 80,000-word thesis.

title: Cyber Security (Cyber Secure Everywhere)
summary: The Cyber Security (Cyber Secure Everywhere) PhD program at the University of Bristol focuses on addressing the challenges of cyber security in an increasingly interconnected world. It offers a unique challenge-led training approach, combining interdisciplinary learning with practical experience from industry experts. Students will engage in innovative research to develop solutions for future infrastructure security and resilience.
requirements: Applicants must hold a minimum of an upper-second class honours degree (or international equivalent) in a relevant discipline. The program welcomes candidates from various backgrounds, including computer science, psychology, management, engineering, criminology, and social sciences.
structure: The program lasts four years, with the first year focusing on taught units and transferable skills training. Students then progress to independent research, culminating in internationally publishable work.

title: DEdPsy Educational Psychology
summary: The Doctor of Educational Psychology (DEdPsy) is a research degree accredited by the British Psychological Society and the Health and Care Professions Council, designed to meet the professional training needs of educational psychologists. It focuses on advanced knowledge in child development, educational psychology, and research methodology, culminating in a dissertation. The program prepares graduates for professional practice in educational psychology.
requirements: An upper second-class honours degree in psychology (or equivalent) that confers Graduate Basis for Chartered Membership with the British Psychological Society, along with relevant experience working with children or young people (aged 0-25). Applicants with a lower second-class degree and relevant experience may be considered.
structure: The program lasts 3 years full-time, with a maximum period of 4 years. It includes advanced knowledge in child development, educational psychology, and research methodology, with assessment through written assignments and a dissertation.

title: Disability Studies
summary: The PhD in Disability Studies at the University of Bristol focuses on linking theory, policy, and practice in a multidisciplinary environment. It aims to influence national and international policy through research that addresses social concerns affecting disabled individuals. The program is supported by the Norah Fry Research Centre, which emphasizes applied social research and the human rights of people with disabilities.
requirements: An upper second-class honours degree and a merit at MSc/MA level (or equivalent experience/qualification).
structure: The program duration is up to four years full-time or eight years part-time, with a focus on research relevant to national and international policy.

title: Earth Sciences
summary: The Earth Sciences program at the University of Bristol offers PhD and MSc by research degrees, focusing on a wide range of interdisciplinary research areas within earth sciences. The program benefits from strong international links and state-of-the-art laboratories, emphasizing experimental and theoretical studies of Earth's physical, chemical, and biological processes. Students are encouraged to engage in collaborative research across various disciplines.
requirements: An upper second-class honours degree (or equivalent) in a related discipline such as geology, biological sciences, environmental sciences, physics, chemistry, or mathematics is required. For PhD-level study, a master's in a relevant discipline or equivalent experience is desirable.
structure: The MScR program lasts up to two years full-time or four years part-time, while the PhD program lasts up to four years full-time or eight years part-time.

title: East Asian Studies
summary: The PhD in East Asian Studies at the University of Bristol offers advanced research opportunities in an interdisciplinary environment, focusing on East and South Asian societies, culture, and politics. Students engage with critical issues such as security, migration, gender, and climate crisis, supported by expert supervisors and a diverse scholarly community. The program emphasizes rigorous research methodologies and aims to contribute to a better understanding of contemporary global challenges.
requirements: An upper second-class undergraduate honours degree (or equivalent) and normally a merit at MSc/MA level (or equivalent). English language requirements apply for non-native speakers.
structure: The program duration is up to four years full-time or eight years part-time, with a focus on independent research throughout. Students are encouraged to apply for September or January starts.

title: Economics
summary: The PhD in Economics at the University of Bristol offers a robust research environment, ranking in the top 5 UK universities for research. The program emphasizes innovative, policy-focused research and provides students with opportunities to engage with a diverse academic community. Students are encouraged to collaborate with faculty and present their work in seminars, fostering a strong research culture.
requirements: Standard entry is typically from the MRes Economics program, but direct entry is also considered for those with an MRes or MPhil Economics degree from another institution. GRE scores are recommended for applicants whose master's studies were outside Europe, the US, or Canada. English language proficiency is required for non-native speakers.
structure: The PhD program can be pursued full-time for up to 4 years or part-time for up to 8 years. Students are encouraged to interact with faculty and participate in seminars throughout their studies.

title: Education
summary: The PhD in Education at the University of Bristol offers high-quality supervision by internationally-recognised scholars across various educational fields. Students will engage in research training, design their own research projects, and become part of a diverse doctoral community. The program emphasizes professional development, networking opportunities, and access to extensive resources.
requirements: An upper second-class undergraduate honours degree (or equivalent) and normally a merit at MSc/MA level (or equivalent). English language requirements apply for non-native speakers.
structure: The PhD program focuses on conducting research leading to a dissertation, with support from academic supervisors. Students will undertake research training and then design and conduct their own research project.

title: Electrical and Electronic Engineering
summary: The Electrical and Electronic Engineering program at the University of Bristol offers PhD and MSc by research degrees, focusing on world-leading research in areas such as mobile communication systems, microelectronics, and electrical energy management. The program is supported by a strong faculty and extensive collaboration with industrial organizations, providing students with opportunities for substantial research funding and career development.
requirements: PhD applicants must hold a minimum of a merit at master's degree level in a relevant discipline or a first class undergraduate degree. MSc by Research applicants need an upper second class honours degree in a relevant discipline.
structure: The program duration is up to four years full-time or eight years part-time, with a focus on research throughout.

title: Engineering Biology
summary: The Engineering Biology PhD program at the University of Bristol focuses on addressing global challenges through innovative solutions at the intersection of biology, chemistry, engineering, AI, and data science. It offers bespoke cohort-based training in synthetic biology, preparing students to translate concepts into impactful products. The program includes hands-on research projects, specialized training, and collaboration with industrial partners.
requirements: Applicants should hold or be predicted to achieve a first-class or strong upper second-class undergraduate degree with honours in engineering, biology, biochemistry, chemistry, physics, mathematics, computer science, medicine, or related disciplines.
structure: The first year is divided into three segments: foundation training in Bristol and Oxford, specialized training in engineering biology, and individual research projects. The second and third years focus on the substantive PhD project.

title: Engineering Mathematics
summary: The Engineering Mathematics program at the University of Bristol focuses on applying mathematics to address future challenges in engineering, industry, and life sciences. It emphasizes interdisciplinary research, international collaboration, and significant theoretical and computational advancements. The program is supported by various public and private funding bodies, ensuring a robust research environment.
requirements: PhD applicants must hold a minimum of a merit at master's degree level (or international equivalent) in a relevant discipline. MSc by Research applicants need an upper second class honours degree (or international equivalent) in a relevant discipline and demonstrate readiness for research.
structure: MScR: up to two years full-time; up to four years part-time. PhD: up to four years full-time; up to eight years part-time.
careers: mathematical modelling and simulation in engineering consultancies

title: English Literature
summary: The English Literature program at the University of Bristol offers PhD and MPhil degrees, focusing on textual scholarship, critical analysis, and interdisciplinary research across various literary periods. The department emphasizes a broad range of research interests, including medieval literature, modernism, and contemporary writing, fostering doctoral research both within the department and in collaboration with other disciplines. Students benefit from skills training workshops and have opportunities for teaching and auditing relevant master's units.

requirements.MPhil: An upper second-class degree or international equivalent.
requirements.PhD: A master's qualification or working towards one, or international equivalent. Exceptional cases may be considered for first-class undergraduate degree holders.

structure: MPhil: one-year full-time research degree culminating in a 25,000-word dissertation. PhD: research project over four years (minimum three years), culminating in an 80,000-word thesis, with opportunities for teaching and auditing relevant units.

title: Exercise, Nutrition and Health
summary: The PhD in Exercise, Nutrition and Health equips students with the skills to apply research methods to critically examine contemporary issues in physical activity and nutrition. Students develop research questions and design studies that contribute to public health knowledge, often collaborating with relevant organizations. The program supports diverse research interests, including epidemiology, dietary assessment, and behavior change.
requirements: An upper second-class honours degree and a merit at MSc/MA level (or equivalent experience/qualification). English language requirements apply for non-native speakers.
structure: The program duration is up to four years full-time or eight years part-time, with a focus on developing a research topic related to physical activity and nutrition.

title: Film and Television
summary: The Department of Film and Television at the University of Bristol offers MPhil and PhD programs focusing on a wide range of subject areas including classical Hollywood cinema, British cinema, and television drama. Students can engage in both practice-based and traditional written research, with opportunities for interdisciplinary supervision. The program emphasizes historical research, audience studies, and film theory.

requirements.MPhil: An upper second-class degree or international equivalent, with evidence of readiness for research.
requirements.PhD: A master's qualification or working towards one, or international equivalent. Exceptional cases may be considered for first-class undergraduate degree holders.

structure: MPhil is a one-year full-time research degree culminating in a 25,000-word dissertation. PhD involves a research project over four years, culminating in an 80,000-word thesis, with options to audit taught units and potential teaching opportunities from the second year.
careers: Creative projects in film and television

title: French
summary: The PhD and MPhil programs in French at the University of Bristol focus on research innovation and excellence in various aspects of French Studies, including literature, film, cultural history, and comparative literature. Students benefit from a wide range of expertise and interdisciplinary collaboration, with opportunities for teaching and leading seminar series. The department is also involved in international exchange programs and research centers.

requirements.MPhil: An upper second-class degree or international equivalent.
requirements.PhD: A master's qualification or working towards one, or international equivalent. Exceptional cases may be considered for first-class undergraduate degree holders.

structure: MPhil is a one-year full-time research degree culminating in a 25,000-word dissertation. PhD involves a research project over four years, culminating in an 80,000-word thesis, with options to audit taught units and potential teaching opportunities from the second year.
careers: High-level research projects in French Studies

title: Future Innovation in Non-Destructive Evaluation
summary: The Future Innovation in Non-Destructive Evaluation (FIND CDT) offers EngD and PhD programmes focused on non-destructive evaluation technologies. It connects universities with industry partners to provide research opportunities that address the needs of UK industry. Students receive training from leading experts and engage in cohort-based learning, preparing them for innovative roles in various sectors.
requirements: Applicants should have or expect to obtain a first class or good 2:1 degree or Master's in engineering or physical science. Strong problem-solving skills, interest in useful research, organization, and communication abilities are essential.
structure: The first three years include cohort-based taught units focusing on advanced technical courses, innovation, and entrepreneurship, along with opportunities for science communication and public engagement.

title: Geographic Data Science
summary: The Geographic Data Science program at the University of Bristol trains future geographic data and quantitative social scientists to address geospatial challenges using data science and quantitative methods. It emphasizes methodological innovation and welcomes applicants from diverse backgrounds, including geography, social science, and computer science.
requirements: An upper second-class degree (or equivalent) with at least 60 credits in geographic data science and a dissertation focused on the same. English language requirements apply for non-native speakers.
structure: The program duration is up to four years full-time or eight years part-time, with a focus on methodological innovation and application throughout.

title: Geographical Sciences (Human Geography)
summary: The PhD in Geographical Sciences (Human Geography) at the University of Bristol offers a vibrant and interdisciplinary research environment, focusing on various human geographical topics such as health inequalities, urban sustainability, and political ecology. The program emphasizes the importance of securing supervisory support before application and encourages candidates from diverse backgrounds to apply. With a strong emphasis on world-leading research, students will engage in a dynamic postgraduate community.
requirements: An upper second-class honours degree in a relevant subject or an equivalent qualification, along with a master's qualification from a UK university (or equivalent). Applicants should have an interest in utilizing ESRC and UKRI secondary datasets in their research projects.
structure: The program has no taught elements unless specified by funding conditions. Each student will complete an annual progress review, and the structure is aligned with the wider Faculty and University regulations.

title: Geographical Sciences (Physical Geography)
summary: The PhD in Geographical Sciences (Physical Geography) at the University of Bristol offers a vibrant research environment within a leading international centre for geographical research. Students engage in a wide range of subjects, with opportunities for interdisciplinary collaboration. The program emphasizes world-leading research and provides a supportive community for postgraduate scholars.
requirements: An upper second-class honours degree (or an equivalent qualification) in a relevant subject. English language requirements apply for non-native speakers.
structure: The program has no taught elements unless specified by funding conditions. Each student will complete an annual progress review.

title: German
summary: The German PhD and MPhil programs at the University of Bristol focus on a wide range of research areas within German studies, including language, literature, culture, and history. The department promotes a collaborative research culture and encourages interdisciplinary approaches. Students will engage in their own research projects, with opportunities for teaching experience and participation in academic events.

requirements.MPhil: An upper second-class degree or international equivalent.
requirements.PhD: A master's qualification or be working towards one, or international equivalent. Exceptional cases may be considered for first-class undergraduate degree holders.

structure: MPhil: one-year full-time research degree culminating in a 25,000-word dissertation. PhD: three to four years full-time research project culminating in an 80,000-word thesis, with options to audit taught units and potential for undergraduate teaching experience.

title: Global Challenges and Transformations
summary: The PhD in Global Challenges and Transformations at the University of Bristol focuses on advanced research related to contemporary global dynamics, including geopolitics, political economy, and social inequalities. Students will engage with leading scholars in a supportive environment and benefit from dual supervision. The program combines taught components to develop research skills with a significant research project.
requirements: An upper second-class undergraduate honours degree (or equivalent) and normally a merit at MSc/MA level (or equivalent). English language requirements apply for non-native speakers.
structure: The program includes a taught component focusing on research methods and a research component where students undertake their doctoral research with the support of two supervisors.

title: Great Western Four+ Doctoral Training Partnership (NERC)
summary: The Great Western Four+ Doctoral Training Partnership (NERC) offers a multidisciplinary PhD program focused on NERC sciences, primarily for UK students, with limited opportunities for international students. The program spans 42 months and covers four research themes: Climate Change and Risk, Earth Science and Hazards, Science for Environmental Solutions, and Evolution and Biodiversity Through Space and Time. Students receive training and support for future employment in various fields.
requirements: An upper second-class degree or higher (or international equivalent) in a relevant discipline such as geology, biological sciences, environmental sciences, chemistry, or geography. Additional relevant experience or a master's degree is encouraged.
structure: The program lasts three-and-a-half years full-time, with a maximum of four years. Students will engage in training and research within the four specified themes.

title: Health and Wellbeing
summary: The PhD Health, Wellbeing and Society programme at the University of Bristol focuses on the social determinants of health, lifestyle behaviours, and mental wellbeing. It aims to advance research that influences policy and practice, equipping researchers to tackle global health challenges. The programme is part of the South West Doctoral Training Partnership and emphasizes interdisciplinary collaboration among leading social scientists.
requirements: An upper second class honours degree and a merit at MSc/MA level (or equivalent experience/qualification). English language requirements apply for non-native speakers.
structure: The programme duration is up to four years full-time or eight years part-time, with students typically registered in the school of their first supervisor. Students will have two supervisors from different disciplines and will participate in joint meetings and an annual workshop.

title: Hispanic, Portuguese and Latin American Studies
summary: The Hispanic, Portuguese and Latin American Studies program at the University of Bristol offers research opportunities at the master's (MPhil) and doctoral (PhD) levels, focusing on the connections between cultures, histories, and disciplines across the Hispanic and Lusophone worlds. The program emphasizes global culture and history, encouraging innovative research in areas such as digital humanities and environmental studies. Students engage in a vibrant research community and can tailor their research projects to their interests.

requirements.MPhil: An upper second-class degree (or international equivalent).
requirements.PhD: A master's qualification or working towards one, or international equivalent. Exceptional cases may be considered for first-class undergraduate degree holders.

structure: MPhil is a one-year full-time research degree culminating in a 25,000-word dissertation. PhD involves a research project over three to four years, culminating in an 80,000-word thesis, with options to audit taught units and potential teaching opportunities from the second year.

title: History
summary: The Department of History at the University of Bristol offers expert postgraduate supervision in a diverse range of historical subjects, encouraging interdisciplinary research. Students can pursue either an MPhil or PhD, engaging with a vibrant research community and benefiting from excellent local resources. The program emphasizes the importance of contacting potential supervisors before applying to discuss research proposals.

requirements.MPhil: An upper second-class degree or international equivalent.
requirements.PhD: A master's qualification or working towards one, or international equivalent. Exceptional cases may be considered for first-class undergraduate degree holders.

structure: MPhil is a one-year full-time research degree culminating in a 25,000-word dissertation. PhD involves a research project over four years, culminating in an 80,000-word thesis, with options to audit taught units and potential teaching opportunities from the second year.
careers: Research and communication roles in various professions

title: History of Art
summary: The History of Art program at the University of Bristol offers MPhil and PhD degrees focused on the study of art, visual culture, and theory. The department encourages interdisciplinary approaches and provides a vibrant intellectual environment with research seminars and guest lectures. Students can engage in their own research projects, with options for distance learning and on-campus study.

requirements.MPhil: An upper second-class degree (or international equivalent).
requirements.PhD: A master's qualification or working towards one, or international equivalent. Exceptional cases may be considered for first-class undergraduate degree holders.

structure: MPhil is a one-year full-time research degree culminating in a 25,000-word dissertation. PhD involves a research project over four years (full-time) with an 80,000-word thesis.

title: Innovation and Entrepreneurship
summary: The Innovation and Entrepreneurship program at the University of Bristol offers MPhil and PhD degrees focusing on design innovation and entrepreneurship across commercial and social sectors. The program emphasizes collaborative research and welcomes students from diverse backgrounds, including both recent graduates and experienced professionals. It aims to develop researchers who can contribute meaningfully to innovation practices in various contexts.

requirements.MPhil: An upper second-class degree or international equivalent, with evidence of readiness for research.
requirements.PhD: A master's qualification or working towards one, or international equivalent. Exceptional cases may be considered for first-class undergraduate degree holders.

structure: MPhil involves conducting a significant research project independently under supervision, with no taught element. PhD researchers conduct a longer project culminating in a thesis, with training provided by the Bristol Doctoral College.

title: Italian
summary: The PhD and MPhil programs in Italian at the University of Bristol focus on the interdisciplinary study of Italian culture, literature, visual culture, and cultural history. The department fosters a strong research culture, encouraging students to engage in their own research projects while benefiting from the expertise of faculty members. Both degrees can be pursued via distance learning or on-campus, with opportunities for students to audit relevant master's units.

requirements.MPhil: An upper second-class degree or international equivalent, with evidence of readiness for research.
requirements.PhD: A master's qualification or working towards one, or international equivalent. Exceptional cases may be considered for first-class undergraduate degree holders.

structure: MPhil is a one-year full-time research degree culminating in a 25,000-word dissertation. PhD involves a research project over three to four years, ending with an 80,000-word thesis, with options to audit taught units and potential teaching opportunities from the second year.

title: Law
summary: The PhD Law programme at the University of Bristol offers comprehensive research training under the guidance of renowned legal experts. It is designed for independent research projects and provides opportunities for teaching experience and participation in a vibrant research community. The programme is highly ranked for legal research excellence and supports students with funding for travel and conferences.
requirements: A minimum of an upper second-class honours degree in law (or equivalent) and normally at least a merit at master's level (or equivalent), or a first-class honours degree in law (or equivalent) with evidence of ability to conduct independent research.
structure: PhD students must pass the 20 credit unit Advanced Legal and Socio-Legal Methods within the first 18 months of enrolment. ESRC/SWDTP students may be required to take additional credits as determined by SWDTP.

title: Linguistics
summary: The Linguistics program at the University of Bristol explores the study of human language, its functions in the brain, and its societal usage. With a strong focus on sociolinguistics, students engage in research that addresses social issues through various qualitative and quantitative methods. The program emphasizes collaborative knowledge development and offers opportunities to work with a diverse range of languages.

requirements.MPhil: An upper second-class degree or international equivalent.
requirements.PhD: A master's qualification or working towards one, or international equivalent. Exceptional cases may be considered for first-class undergraduate degree holders.

structure: MPhil is a one-year full-time research degree culminating in a 25,000-word dissertation. PhD involves a research project over four years, culminating in an 80,000-word thesis, with options to audit taught units and potential teaching opportunities from the second year.

title: LLM Law - Banking and Finance Law
summary: The LLM in Banking and Finance Law at the University of Bristol explores contemporary challenges in law, regulation, and policy within the banking and finance sectors. It is designed for those wishing to specialize in banking and financial services law, equipping students with analytical, communication, and research skills valued by employers. The program is well-respected by leading law firms and offers a rigorous, research-rich curriculum.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree in Law or a related field such as Business, Economics, Management, or Finance. Significant professional experience in relevant fields may also be considered.
structure: The program includes four units and a dissertation, with one compulsory unit and three optional units, at least two of which must be from the Banking and Finance Law portfolio.
careers: Lawyer in top international law firms

title: LLM Law - Commercial Law
summary: The LLM Commercial Law program at the University of Bristol explores the intersection of law and business, focusing on business transactions and key concepts like risk and party autonomy. It covers subjects such as contract law, sale of goods, and international commercial arbitration, while developing crucial analytical and research skills. The program is ideal for those pursuing a career in commercial law or seeking to understand the law-business dynamic.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree in Law or a related field such as Business, Economics, Management, or Finance. Significant academic or professional experience may also be considered.
structure: The program includes four units and a compulsory dissertation, with one compulsory unit and three optional units, at least two from the Commercial Law portfolio.
careers: Lawyers in national and international law firms

title: LLM Law - Company Law and Corporate Governance
summary: The LLM Company Law and Corporate Governance at the University of Bristol provides an in-depth understanding of legal, financial, and governance issues in corporate activities. It offers a range of optional units to explore various perspectives on company law and corporate governance, making it ideal for those pursuing careers in law, finance, business, and academia. The program emphasizes analytical, communication, and research skills valued by top employers.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or equivalent in Law or a related field such as Business, Economics, Management, or Finance. Significant academic or professional experience may also be considered.
structure: The program includes four units and a compulsory dissertation, with one compulsory unit and three optional units, at least two from the Company Law and Corporate Governance portfolio.

title: LLM Law - Employment, Work and Equality

title: LLM Law - General Legal Studies
summary: The LLM General Legal Studies at the University of Bristol offers a customizable program with over 40 postgraduate units, allowing students to tailor their studies to their interests. It is designed for those pursuing careers in law, policy, business, and academia, emphasizing analytical, communication, and research skills. The program is well-respected by leading law firms and is supported by world-leading academics.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in Law or a related field such as Business, Economics, History, or Politics is required. Significant academic or professional experience may also be considered.
structure: Students select four units from the LLM programs and complete a compulsory dissertation, which can be a group or individual project.
careers: Lawyers in national and international law firms

title: LLM Law - Health, Law and Society
summary: The LLM Health, Law, and Society at the University of Bristol offers an in-depth exploration of healthcare law, focusing on issues such as health inequalities, reproductive justice, and mental health. This programme is designed for those pursuing careers in health law, regulation, policy, and research, equipping students with essential analytical and communication skills. It is delivered by world-leading academics within a research-rich environment.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree (or equivalent) in Law or a related discipline is required. Degrees in Health Care or Health Science subjects will be considered on a case-by-case basis. A personal statement and reference are required for Health Care or Health Science subjects.
structure: The programme includes four units and a compulsory dissertation, with core units in Health Inequalities, Law, and Society, and Law, Governance, and Health. Students can also choose optional units related to Health, Law and Society.
careers: Lawyer in a global law firm

title: LLM Law - Human Rights Law
summary: The LLM Human Rights Law at the University of Bristol offers an in-depth study of global human rights legal frameworks, exploring international and regional institutions, as well as specialized areas like employment law, health law, and migration law. The program is designed to develop crucial analytical, communication, and research skills, preparing students for careers in human rights law, policy, and research. Students will engage with world-leading academics and have opportunities for practical experience through the Human Rights Law Clinic.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree in Law or a related field such as Politics or International Relations is required. Applications may also be considered for those with significant academic or professional experience in relevant fields.
structure: The program includes four units and a compulsory dissertation, with one compulsory unit and three optional units, at least two of which must be from the Human Rights pathway. Students can choose between a group or individual dissertation.
careers: Roles in international organizations such as the UN
Careers in government departments, NGOs, and think tanks

title: LLM Law - International Commercial Law
summary: The LLM International Commercial Law at the University of Bristol offers an in-depth study of transnational business transactions, international commercial arbitration, and trade rules. This program equips students with critical analytical, communication, and research skills essential for navigating the global legal landscape. It is ideal for those pursuing careers in commercial law, in-house legal roles, and consultancy.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in Law, or a related field such as Business, Economics, Management, or Finance. Significant academic or professional experience may also be considered.
structure: The program includes four units and a compulsory dissertation, with one compulsory unit and three optional units, at least two from the International Commercial Law pathway. Students can choose between a group or individual dissertation.

title: LLM Law - International Law
summary: The LLM International Law at the University of Bristol offers a comprehensive grounding in public international law and the complexities of international relations. Students will explore general principles and specialize in areas such as human rights, armed conflict, and trade law. The program is designed to enhance analytical, communication, and research skills, preparing graduates for careers in global law firms and governmental organizations.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree in Law or a related field such as History, Politics, or International Relations is required. Significant professional experience in relevant fields may also be considered.
structure: The program includes four units and a compulsory dissertation, with options to specialize in three International Law units and one unit from other LLM programs.

title: LLM Law, Environment, Sustainability and Business
summary: The LLM Law, Environment, Sustainability, and Business at the University of Bristol offers an in-depth study of environmental and sustainability law, focusing on the role of business in sustainable development. The program equips students with essential skills for careers in corporate ESG, environmental agencies, consultancies, government, and NGOs. It emphasizes critical analysis of environmental law and governance, alongside corporate governance in business organizations.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree in Law or a related field such as Politics, Economics, Business, or Sociology is required. Significant academic or professional experience in relevant fields may also be considered.
structure: The program includes four units and a compulsory dissertation. Students must take the mandatory unit 'Legal Perspectives on Sustainability' and can choose from three specialist units related to the LLM Environment, Sustainability and Business, plus one unit from other LLMs.

title: LLM Law, Innovation and Technology
summary: The LLM Law, Innovation and Technology at the University of Bristol provides an opportunity to master legal expertise in addressing challenges related to technology and innovation. Students will study IT law and can choose from various specialist units, preparing them for careers in commercial law, tech innovation, and digital markets. The program emphasizes analytical, communication, and research skills, supported by world-leading academics.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree in Law or a related field such as Computer Science, Data Science, Management, Economics, Philosophy, or Policy Studies. Significant academic or professional experience may also be considered.
structure: The program includes four units and a compulsory dissertation, with all students taking an IT law unit. Students can select three additional units from specialist topics or from other LLM programs.

title: MA Anthropology
summary: The MA in Anthropology at the University of Bristol provides a comprehensive understanding of anthropological research, focusing on contemporary social and political issues. Students will engage with real-world challenges through advanced training in theory and methods, alongside opportunities for practical experience in various cultural and social organizations. The program emphasizes a cross-cultural perspective and aims to enhance employability through valuable research experience.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in an arts, humanities, or social sciences discipline is required. Non-traditional qualifications may also be considered. Relevant work experience or a postgraduate qualification can strengthen your application.
structure: The program includes two mandatory units focusing on Anthropological Theory and Practice, and Research Methods in Anthropology. Optional units allow for tailoring the program to individual interests, including work placement opportunities.

programmes.title: Education (Flexible)
programmes.summary: The Education (Part time only) program offers flexible research opportunities in education, including entry requirements, supervisors, and research groups.

programmes.title: Electrical and Electronic Engineering
programmes.summary: This PhD program in Electrical and Electronic Engineering focuses on advanced research in engineering technologies, including entry requirements and research groups.

programmes.title: Engineering Biology
programmes.summary: The PhD in Engineering Biology emphasizes research in biological engineering, including entry requirements and research groups.

programmes.title: Engineering Mathematics
programmes.summary: This PhD program in Engineering Mathematics focuses on advanced research in mathematical applications in engineering, including entry requirements, career prospects, and research groups.

programmes.title: English Literature
programmes.summary: The PhD in English Literature focuses on advanced research in literary studies, including entry requirements, supervisors, and research groups.

programmes.title: Exercise, Nutrition and Health
programmes.summary: This PhD program in Exercise, Nutrition and Health focuses on research in health sciences, including entry requirements, supervisors, and research groups.

title: MA Chinese-English Audiovisual Translation
summary: The MA Translation and Intercultural Studies is an interdisciplinary program that examines communication across linguistic, cultural, and societal differences. It combines literary, media, technology, and accessibility studies, allowing students to develop critical skills in translation and intercultural communication. The program emphasizes multilingualism and offers opportunities for specialization through optional units and independent study projects.
requirements: Typically, an upper second class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Applicants must demonstrate competency in a language other than English and submit a personal statement outlining relevant language experience.
structure: The program includes three mandatory core units in Teaching Block 1, followed by optional units in Teaching Block 2, allowing students to specialize in pathways such as Literary Translation, Media and Accessibility, or Technology and Society. A research project is completed over the summer and submitted in the Dissertation unit.

title: MA Chinese-English Translation
summary: The MA in Chinese-English Translation at the University of Bristol prepares students for careers in professional language services and academic research. The program emphasizes practical translation informed by theory, enhancing verbal and written communication skills while mastering digital tools. It is open to both native and non-native Chinese speakers, focusing on advanced translation skills and cultural knowledge.
requirements: For native Chinese speakers: upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in any subject. For non-native speakers: upper second-class honours degree in Chinese Studies or similar, or completion of a full program at a prestigious Chinese institution. Proficiency may be demonstrated through a translation test.
structure: Year 1 includes three core units in the first term: Theories of Translation, Translation Practice and Analysis, and CAT Tools, followed by a core unit in practical translation and a dissertation in the second term. Optional units may include subtitling, translation industry, videogame localisation, and interpreting.
careers: Interpreter in international corporate and government institutions

title: MA Comparative Literatures and Cultures
summary: The MA in Comparative Literatures and Cultures at the University of Bristol offers an exploration of literary and cultural products across national and linguistic borders. Students will engage with comparative literary and cultural studies, gaining skills in critical reading and research while studying various themes and topics. The program culminates in a dissertation, allowing for original academic research.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in an arts or humanities discipline is required. A module in literature or related literature module at 60% or international equivalent is necessary. Non-traditional qualifications may also be considered.
structure: The program includes three core units and three optional units, followed by a dissertation of approximately 12,000 words.
careers: Doctoral studies in the humanities and arts

title: MA Composition of Music for Film and Television
summary: The MA in Composition of Music for Film and Television offers professional training in screen media composition, focusing on film, television, and game scoring. Students will gain technological skills and creative experience while collaborating on projects within the media industry. The program emphasizes original music creation for various screen media and provides opportunities for networking and professional development.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in Music, plus a portfolio demonstrating composition experience. Non-traditional qualifications may be considered. Relevant work experience or a postgraduate qualification can strengthen applications.
structure: The program includes four core units and two optional units, culminating in a media composition portfolio/dissertation featuring approximately 18 to 20 minutes of original music for collaborative projects.

title: MA Creative Innovation and Entrepreneurship
summary: The MA in Creative Innovation and Entrepreneurship at the University of Bristol is designed for aspiring creative leaders, artists, designers, and entrepreneurs. The program emphasizes hands-on learning and collaboration with industry partners to tackle real-world creative challenges. Students will develop critical skills to design, launch, and scale innovative ventures across various sectors, including film, media, and digital arts.
requirements: Typically, an upper second class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Relevant work experience in the creative sector and additional qualifications may strengthen your application.
structure: The program is structured across three phases: Term 1 focuses on mastering core innovation skills, Term 2 involves applying learning in real-world business scenarios, and the Summer project culminates in launching a new creative venture.
careers: Designers and Strategists in global firms
Innovation and Change Leaders in FinTech companies

title: MA Creative Writing
summary: The MA in Creative Writing at the University of Bristol is designed for aspiring writers looking to publish their work. The program includes supportive workshops, lectures, and seminars that enhance writing skills and understanding of contemporary literature. Students will engage with industry experts and develop their manuscripts with professional guidance, culminating in a creative dissertation.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or equivalent in English Literature, Drama, or Creative Writing is required. Nonstandard routes are considered based on a writing portfolio. Applicants should submit a portfolio of no more than 10 pages of fiction or creative non-fiction.
structure: The first year for full-time students includes Workshop One and Contemporary Critical Issues in the first term, followed by Workshop Two and Critical Issues in Contemporary Publishing in the second term, and a Creative Dissertation over the summer.

title: MA Digital Business Innovation
summary: The MA Digital Business Innovation programme at the University of Bristol is designed for individuals aiming to lead digital transformation in various organizations. It caters to applicants from diverse academic backgrounds and focuses on leveraging digital tools for business growth. The curriculum includes practical projects with industry partners, emphasizing real-world application and networking opportunities.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Applications may be considered with slightly lower interim grades or if a relevant postgraduate qualification is held.
structure: The programme includes foundational units in The Role of AI in Digital Innovation and Advanced Digital Business, followed by a practical client project and a comprehensive Digital Innovation Project that synthesizes all learning.

title: MA Digital Media Innovation
summary: The MA Digital Media Innovation programme is tailored for creative professionals and media enthusiasts aiming to enhance their skills in the digital media landscape. It focuses on multimedia storytelling, interactive media, and digital content creation, combining theoretical frameworks with practical applications. Students will collaborate with leading media companies and engage in hands-on projects, preparing them for various media industries.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Applications may be considered with slightly lower interim grades or if a relevant postgraduate qualification is held.
structure: The programme includes core units such as Tools and Methods for Digital Innovation and User Experience Design Fundamentals. Students will engage in a practical client project in the second term and complete a capstone Digital Media Innovation Project in the final term.

title: MA English Literature
summary: The MA in English Literature at the University of Bristol aims to deepen students' passion for literature while developing essential skills for postgraduate-level research. The program offers four pathways, allowing students to focus on specific literary periods or combine optional units to suit their interests. Students will engage with a supportive academic community and complete a dissertation of up to 12,000 words.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent with 60% or above in any dissertation/research component is required. Applicants may also need to provide evidence of relevant work experience or a relevant postgraduate qualification.
structure: The program includes taught units that align with students' interests, followed by a dissertation of up to 12,000 words after completing the taught portion.

title: MA Environmental Humanities
summary: The MA in Environmental Humanities at the University of Bristol explores the interplay between human behavior, beliefs, and the environment, integrating disciplines such as environmental history, literature, philosophy, and anthropology. The program emphasizes real-world environmental challenges through partnerships and innovative projects, while also developing vital communication and research skills. Students can design their own interdisciplinary pathways and engage in practical projects, preparing them for various careers in sustainability and research.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in any Arts, Humanities, or Social Sciences discipline (including Geography) is required. Additional qualifications may strengthen your application.
structure: The program is structured to allow students to combine core units on Environmental Humanities with optional units across various disciplines. It includes innovative assessment methods and a dissertation unit with collaborative and practice-based options.

title: MA Film and Television
summary: The MA Film and Television program at the University of Bristol integrates filmmaking practice with critical and historical approaches to film and television studies. Students will develop high-level analytical skills while engaging in practical filmmaking and exploring narrative and aesthetic possibilities. The course emphasizes independent learning and offers a range of research methods, supported by experienced faculty and industry professionals.
requirements: An upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in Film Studies or related essay-based subjects. Degrees outside this list must include a 2:1 or equivalent in at least four relevant modules. Relevant work experience or qualifications may also be considered.
structure: The program is structured to develop skills cumulatively, with the first term focusing on written analysis and practical filmmaking. The second term emphasizes research approaches, leading to a dissertation stage where students can choose from various options including industrial placements or extended essays.

title: MA History
summary: The MA in History at the University of Bristol is designed for those looking to deepen their understanding of historical contexts or pursue a career in history-related fields. The program offers a variety of historical approaches and opportunities for independent research, alongside engagement with external partners. Students can specialize in areas such as race, colonialism, environmental history, and public history, while benefiting from a vibrant postgraduate community.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent with a minimum mark of 60% in the final-year dissertation is required. Relevant work experience or a postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The MA comprises six taught units and a dissertation. Students typically take two core units in the first term, followed by optional units and a dissertation in the third term.

title: MA History of Art

title: MA Immersive Arts (Virtual and Augmented Reality)
summary: The MA in Immersive Arts (Virtual and Augmented Reality) at the University of Bristol focuses on equipping students with the creative and technical skills necessary to produce engaging immersive content and interactive experiences. The program emphasizes critical and practical skills in creative technologies and immersive storytelling, preparing graduates for a rapidly growing sector. Students will learn from leading academics and industry partners, gaining insights into emerging media and the evolving creative industries.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Applications may be considered with slightly lower interim grades or if additional qualifications are provided.
structure: The program includes an introduction to immersive media technologies, interactive storytelling, and creative content creation. Students will engage in practical projects, culminating in a 60-credit research or practical project.
careers: Animation, film and screen media companies

title: MA Law
summary: The MA Law at the University of Bristol is designed for students with an undergraduate degree in any discipline who wish to pursue a legal career. This two-year program offers a comprehensive legal grounding and prepares students for the professional stage of legal training, culminating in a Master’s level postgraduate law degree. Students will study core legal subjects and have the opportunity to choose optional units or conduct research projects.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. If currently completing a degree, interim grades may be considered for an aspirational offer.
structure: Year 1 includes two core units in each semester, while Year 2 comprises three final core units and one optional unit.
careers: Solicitors or barristers in the UK
Advisers in international organisations or NGOs

title: MA Medieval Studies

For information on postgraduate programmes, please refer to the postgraduate study homepage. The University of Bristol offers a variety of courses and resources for prospective students.
