title: MA Music
summary: The MA in Music at the University of Bristol offers five flexible pathways: Performance, Composition, Musicology, Medieval Music, and Russian Music. Students engage in core training and specialized units, culminating in a major project such as a dissertation, recital, or portfolio. The program emphasizes cross-disciplinary perspectives and is supported by world-leading research.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in Music is required. Applicants for Composition or Performance pathways must submit a portfolio, while Musicology applicants need to address specific questions in their personal statement.
structure: The program includes three core units in Year 1: Research Skills for Musicians, Readings and Repertoires 1 and 2. Students choose from pathway-specific and optional units, leading to a major project.

title: MA Philosophy
summary: The MA in Philosophy at the University of Bristol provides a comprehensive foundation in philosophical research while allowing students to explore their own interests through seven specialist pathways. The program emphasizes critical evaluation of philosophical theories and includes a mandatory dissertation guided by a supervisor. Students are encouraged to engage in the department's vibrant research culture through seminars and workshops.
requirements: Typically, a strong upper second-class honours degree (65% or higher) or an international equivalent in any subject is required. Relevant work experience or a postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The program consists of six taught units and a dissertation of up to 10,000 words. All pathways include a mandatory Philosophical Foundations unit and a selection of core and optional units tailored to each pathway.

title: MA Translation (Online)
summary: The MA Translation and Intercultural Studies is an interdisciplinary program that examines communication across linguistic, cultural, and societal differences. It combines literary, media, technology, and accessibility studies, allowing students to develop critical skills in translation and intercultural communication. The program emphasizes multilingualism and offers opportunities for specialization through optional units and independent study projects.
requirements: Typically, an upper second class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Applicants must demonstrate competency in a language other than English and submit a personal statement outlining relevant language experience.
structure: The program includes three mandatory core units in Teaching Block 1, followed by optional units in Teaching Block 2, allowing students to specialize in pathways such as Literary Translation, Media and Accessibility, or Technology and Society. A research project is completed over the summer and submitted in the Dissertation unit.

title: MA User Experience Design and Innovation
summary: The MA User Experience Design and Innovation programme at the University of Bristol focuses on creating impactful digital experiences through human-centred design principles and usability testing. It combines theoretical knowledge with practical application, allowing students to conduct user research, develop prototypes, and collaborate with industry partners on real-world projects. The programme also includes guest lectures and workshops to enhance understanding of the field.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Applications may be considered with slightly lower interim grades or if a relevant postgraduate qualification is held.
structure: The programme includes core units in User Experience Design Fundamentals and Advanced User Experience Design, a practical client project in the second term, and a comprehensive UX Design Innovation Project as the final component.

title: Management
summary: The PhD in Management at the University of Bristol Business School emphasizes research with practical relevance, encouraging interdisciplinary approaches. Students will join a vibrant PhD community and are required to complete 60 credit points of taught training in their first year. The program is designed to prepare graduates for careers in research, consultancy, or policy-based institutions.
requirements: Applicants must have an upper second-class honours degree in a relevant subject or an equivalent qualification, and either have completed or be completing a master's qualification from a UK university (or equivalent). A minimum of Merit at Master's level is expected, with a Distinction in the research component being desirable.
structure: PhD students are required to complete 60 credits of taught units within the first 18 months of enrolment, typically during the first year of study.

title: Mathematics
summary: The University of Bristol's School of Mathematics offers PhD and MSc by research programs, focusing on both pure and applied mathematics and statistical science. With a strong emphasis on world-class research and collaboration, the program aims to provide high-quality training and supervision for postgraduate students. The school encourages applications from diverse groups and offers various funding opportunities.
requirements: A first-class or upper second-class honours degree (or international equivalent) in mathematics or a closely related subject, or a relevant master's qualification. Higher entry requirements may apply for funded places.
structure: MScR: up to two years full-time; up to four years part-time. PhD: up to four years full-time; up to eight years part-time.

title: Mechanical Engineering
summary: The Mechanical Engineering program at the University of Bristol offers world-leading research opportunities in areas such as clean energy, advanced materials, robotics, and healthcare. Students engage in multidisciplinary research with global partners and benefit from modern laboratory facilities. The program fosters a supportive community for PhD, EngD, and MScR students, emphasizing high-quality research and teaching.
requirements: PhD applicants must hold a minimum of a merit at master's degree level or a first-class undergraduate degree. MSc by Research applicants need an upper second class honours degree in a relevant discipline.
structure: MScR: up to two years full-time; up to four years part-time. PhD: up to four years full-time; up to eight years part-time.

title: Medieval Studies
summary: The Medieval Studies program at the University of Bristol offers interdisciplinary research opportunities in various subject areas, including archaeology, history, and literature. Students can pursue either an MPhil or PhD, benefiting from the expertise of the Centre for Medieval Studies. The program emphasizes independent research and encourages collaboration across disciplines.

requirements.MPhil: An upper second-class degree (or international equivalent).
requirements.PhD: A master's qualification or working towards one, or international equivalent. Exceptional cases may be considered for first-class undergraduate degree holders.

structure: MPhil is a one-year full-time research degree culminating in a 25,000-word dissertation. PhD involves a research project over three to four years, ending with an 80,000-word thesis, with options to audit taught units and potential teaching opportunities from the second year.

title: MRes Economics
summary: The MRes Economics program at the University of Bristol is a two-year course that provides advanced training in microeconomics, macroeconomics, econometrics, and mathematical research methods. It is designed for those aiming to pursue a PhD or a research career, as well as for those seeking to work as economists outside academia. The program emphasizes cutting-edge research and is supported by a strong academic community.
requirements: Typically, a strong MSc degree (65% or above) or international equivalent in Economics, Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry, Engineering, Computer Science, or other quantitative subjects is required. Strong performance in Economics and/or Mathematics modules is essential. Recent study (within the last 5 years) is usually required, but applications may still be considered if slightly over 5 years.
structure: Year 1 focuses on core units in Econometrics, Macroeconomics, Microeconomics, and Mathematical and Research Methods. Year 2 introduces field units to develop specific skills for research, along with a dissertation component supervised by a faculty member.
careers: PhD study at the University of Bristol
UK Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs

title: MRes Education
summary: The MRes in Education at the University of Bristol aims to equip students with the methodological, analytical, and practical skills necessary for a career in educational research. This Economic and Social Research Council-recognised programme is designed for those looking to develop their research capabilities, whether they are new to the field or already working in educational institutions. It includes both taught units and a dissertation, preparing students for potential PhD applications.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in education or research is required. Applicants without a research degree must provide evidence of one unit in research methods. Significant paid work experience in a research role may also be considered.
structure: The programme includes taught units and a dissertation, covering preparatory training for PhD applications. Core units are required for PhD candidates.

title: MRes Health Sciences Research
summary: The MRes Health Sciences Research program at the University of Bristol provides a solid foundation in biomedical research, focusing on research methodology, experimental design, and data interpretation. It includes an eight-month research project within recognized research groups, with options for specialized pathways in Translational Cardiovascular Medicine and Renal Sciences. The program is suitable for graduates in biosciences and clinical subjects, as well as medical, dental, and veterinary students seeking research-intensive intercalation.
requirements: Graduates in biological or related sciences or medical subjects are expected to hold an upper second-class honours degree (or international equivalent). Applicants intercalating from professional programs in medicine, dentistry, and veterinary sciences must have completed year three.
structure: The program includes units on Foundations in Health Sciences Research, Project Proposal, Research Club in Health Sciences Research, and a substantial Research Project. Specialized pathways offer additional units related to cardiovascular or renal sciences.

title: MSc Accounting and Finance
summary: The MSc Accounting and Finance programme at the University of Bristol fosters a deep understanding of accounting and finance, emphasizing research and analytical skills essential for a successful career. It includes a research-based dissertation and offers elective units for specialization. The programme prepares students for graduate-level roles in various sectors, including finance and consulting.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree in Accounting or Finance, or relevant modules at 2:1 level. Additional work experience or qualifications may be considered for applicants with lower grades.
structure: The programme lasts one year full-time, with the first term focusing on contemporary issues and research methods, followed by elective units in the second term, and culminating in a research-based dissertation.

title: MSc Accounting, Accountability and Sustainability
summary: The MSc Accounting, Accountability and Sustainability is a full-time master's programme that explores the intersection of accounting and sustainable business practices. It equips students with technical expertise in financial reporting and management accounting while emphasizing sustainability challenges. The programme prepares graduates for diverse career opportunities in sustainability consulting, corporate social responsibility, and environmental accounting.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in a quantitative subject is required. If the degree subject is not listed, evidence of an upper second-class honours degree with three mathematics units at 60% or above is needed. A-level Mathematics with grade A is acceptable if no quantitative units are present in the degree.
structure: The programme begins with core subjects in accounting and sustainability, followed by advanced topics and elective options in the second term. It concludes with a significant research project.

title: MSc Accounting, Finance and Management
summary: The MSc Accounting, Finance and Management program at the University of Bristol is designed for students aiming to enhance their expertise in these fields through an interdisciplinary approach. It combines theoretical knowledge with practical skills, preparing students for advanced topics and real-world applications. The program includes core and optional units, along with a dissertation project, and is taught by globally recognized academics.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in a quantitative subject is required. A-level Mathematics with grade A is acceptable if no quantitative units are included in the degree. Relevant work experience or additional qualifications may also be considered.
structure: The program is structured over one year, with the first teaching block focusing on foundational skills in accounting, finance, and management, followed by advanced topics in the second block. Students can choose optional units and must complete a dissertation project.

title: MSc Advanced Composites
summary: The MSc in Composites Engineering at the University of Bristol equips engineers with the skills to develop lightweight, high-performance solutions for industries such as aerospace, automotive, and energy. The program emphasizes hands-on experience and industry collaboration, preparing students for impactful careers in advanced materials. Students will learn from experts at the Bristol Composites Institute and engage in cutting-edge research.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree (60% or higher) or an international equivalent in Engineering or related fields such as Mechanical, Aerospace, Civil, or Materials. Relevant work experience or a postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The program includes a strong foundation in composite materials science and mechanics, design, analysis, and manufacture of composite structures, culminating in a research-based dissertation project.

title: MSc Advanced Microelectronic Systems Engineering
summary: The MSc in Advanced Microelectronic Systems Engineering at the University of Bristol is designed to address the skills gap in the semiconductor industry. It covers core topics such as ASIC design, DSP, FPGA-based computing, and embedded systems, while also incorporating emerging disciplines like IoT and quantum photonics. Students will gain practical experience through lab exercises and a Capstone project, preparing them for careers in various technology sectors.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in Engineering, Science, or Technology is required. Applicants must have scores of 55% in Analogue Electronics, Digital Electronics, Programming, and Signals and Systems, or equivalent modules.
structure: The programme consists of taught units and a final Capstone project. Five core units are taken in the autumn and spring, with an additional unit on Engineering Project Skills in the spring term to prepare for the Capstone project.

title: MSc Aerial Robotics
summary: The MSc Aerial Robotics program at the University of Bristol equips students with the skills to innovate in aerial robotic systems, focusing on challenges related to Uncrewed Air Vehicles (UAVs) and drones. It combines foundational engineering principles with advanced technologies such as autonomous navigation and AI. Students will engage in hands-on projects and research, collaborating with industry partners. The course emphasizes a systems approach to drone research and development.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in any subject is required, along with a module in programming languages such as C/C++, Java, Python, or MATLAB. Experience in these languages can also be demonstrated through a CV or personal statement.
structure: The program comprises core and optional units, with a significant research project in the second term that accounts for one-third of the MSc. Projects can cover themes from advanced control to bio-inspired technologies.

title: MSc Aerospace Engineering
summary: The MSc Aerospace Engineering programme at the University of Bristol is designed for engineering graduates who wish to deepen their knowledge in advanced aerospace topics and develop essential skills for the industry. It offers a flexible curriculum that allows students to specialize or maintain a broader focus, with opportunities for hands-on experience through collaborative design projects and cutting-edge research. Graduates will be well-prepared to tackle challenges in the aerospace sector and lead the development of innovative solutions.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in Aerospace Engineering or Mechanical Engineering is required. Alternatively, a degree in another Engineering subject with relevant units in Aerodynamics, Aeronautics, and Aerospace Structures is acceptable. English language proficiency is also required for non-native speakers.
structure: The programme spans one year, with Term 1 focusing on foundational and specialized learning, Term 2 on collaborative design and advanced research, and Term 3 dedicated to pioneering research and innovation.

title: MSc Applied Neuropsychology
summary: The MSc Applied Neuropsychology course at the University of Bristol is designed to train and inspire future clinicians, researchers, and allied professionals in the field of neuropsychology. Delivered in partnership with North Bristol Trust, the course emphasizes both theoretical knowledge and practical skills, focusing on neuropsychological disorders, assessment, and rehabilitation. Students will engage with experienced clinicians and have opportunities for research within the NHS.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in Psychology or a closely related discipline is required. For joint degrees, at least half of the content must be in psychology with a minimum score of 60% in relevant modules.
structure: The programme consists of five taught units and an empirical dissertation, covering topics such as clinical neuropsychology, assessment principles, theoretical neuropsychology, neurorehabilitation, and evidence-based neuropsychology.

title: MSc Applied Neuropsychology (Online)
summary: The MSc in Applied Neuropsychology (Online) focuses on clinical neuropsychology, providing training in assessment, formulation, and rehabilitation of neuropsychological disorders. Delivered in partnership with the NHS, the program includes a clinical dissertation and emphasizes evidence-based approaches. Students will learn from practicing clinicians and develop skills for careers in clinical settings or research.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or equivalent in Psychology or a closely related discipline is required. For joint degrees, at least half of the content must be in psychology with a minimum score of 60%. Relevant postgraduate qualifications may also be considered.
structure: The program consists of five taught units and a clinical dissertation. Key units include Applied Clinical Neuropsychology, Issues in Clinical Neuropsychology, Theoretical Neuropsychology, Neurorehabilitation, and Evidence Based Neuropsychology.

title: MSc Banking, Regulation and Financial Stability
summary: The MSc in Global Banking and Finance equips students with specialized skills and knowledge for careers in banking and financial services, focusing on regulation, supervision, compliance, and risk management. It is designed for graduates in economics or finance and offers a case study approach to learning, with opportunities for interaction with experienced professionals in the field.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in a quantitative subject such as Accounting and Finance, Economics, or Engineering. A-level Mathematics with grade A is required if no mathematical units are in the degree. Relevant work experience or qualifications may also be considered.
structure: The programme includes six units: five core units and one elective specialist unit, culminating in a project-based dissertation on a relevant banking topic.

title: MSc Bioinformatics
summary: The MSc Bioinformatics program at the University of Bristol covers a diverse range of areas in bioinformatics, suitable for students from various life sciences backgrounds. It emphasizes the use of computational tools to analyze large datasets in fields such as conservation biology and genetics. Students will engage in a scientific research project and develop professional skills to enhance their employability in a rapidly expanding job market.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in life sciences (e.g., biological sciences, biochemistry) is required. If not, a STEM degree with a module in Genetics, Genomics, Biochemistry, or Molecular Biology at 60% or above is needed.
structure: The program comprises taught units covering core bioinformatics skills and applications across two terms, followed by a research project from May to September.
careers: Roles in public projects like Genomics England and the Darwin Tree of Life

title: MSc Biomedical Sciences Research
summary: The MSc Biomedical Sciences Research program at the University of Bristol is designed to provide students with advanced knowledge and practical skills in contemporary research related to human health and disease. Students will engage in innovative research approaches, gain laboratory experience, and develop critical thinking and communication skills. The program offers flexibility through optional units and project choices, allowing students to tailor their studies to their interests and career aspirations.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in a Life Sciences subject is required. Relevant practical lab-based experience is necessary for graduates from more than five years ago. Additional qualifications or work experience may strengthen applications.
structure: The program includes a mandatory Core Skills unit, Literature Review, Project Proposal, and two optional units, culminating in a research project.

title: MSc Biorobotics
summary: The MSc Biorobotics program at the University of Bristol focuses on designing robots inspired by biological systems to address global challenges. It combines life sciences and engineering, equipping students with skills in robotics and AI. The program includes hands-on projects and a capstone unit, preparing graduates for interdisciplinary roles in the robotics and life sciences sectors.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in a Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics subject is required. Applicants from other backgrounds may be considered on a case-by-case basis.
structure: The program shares a common core with other robotics programs and includes units on Robotics Systems, Artificial Intelligence for Robotics, and Advanced Topics in Robotics, culminating in a bespoke capstone unit 'Biorobotics' and a final dissertation.

title: MSc Business Analytics
summary: The MSc Business Analytics is a one-year specialist programme designed to equip students with advanced skills in descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics. It combines rigorous analytical training with practical problem-solving and communication skills, preparing graduates to bridge the gap between technical expertise and business leadership. The programme emphasizes professional standards and employability, offering hands-on experience through consulting projects with industry partners.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or equivalent in a quantitative subject is required. A-level Mathematics with grade A is acceptable if no quantitative units are in the degree. Relevant work experience may also be considered.
structure: The programme consists of four core units, two optional units, and a final dissertation project. The first term focuses on foundational analytics skills, while the second term allows for elective specialization in areas such as social media analytics and decision-making.
careers: Companies: PwC China, Capgemini, Deloitte South Asia, Reckitt, Volkswagen

title: MSc Business Innovation and Entrepreneurship
summary: The MSc in Business Innovation and Entrepreneurship at the University of Bristol prepares students to drive transformative change within established organizations and launch new ventures. The program emphasizes practical, hands-on learning and focuses on corporate entrepreneurship, equipping graduates with the skills to innovate and lead in various business contexts. Students will engage in real-world challenges and gain insights into leveraging AI for corporate strategy.
requirements: Typically, an upper second class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline. Relevant work experience of at least six months is preferred. Additional qualifications may strengthen the application.
structure: The program is structured across three phases: Term 1 focuses on becoming a Corporate Innovator, Term 2 involves applying skills in real-world business scenarios, and the Summer project culminates in launching a new venture.
careers: Corporate Innovation Managers at FinTech companies like Monzo
Programme Managers in international start-up ecosystems
Designers and Strategists in global firms

title: Global Environmental Challenges
summary: The MSc by research in Global Environmental Challenges at the University of Bristol allows students to conduct independent environmental research on a subject of their choosing. Students can apply for pre-designed projects or propose their own, working with expert supervisors while engaging in a training program to enhance their career prospects. The program emphasizes research skills, interdisciplinarity, and communication, preparing graduates to address pressing environmental issues.
requirements: An upper second-class honours degree (or equivalent) in a relevant topic. Applicants with a lower class of degree and relevant professional experience may be considered. English language requirements apply for non-native speakers.
structure: The program structure varies based on the chosen project and research methods. Students will develop a research plan with their supervisor(s) and participate in interdisciplinary training during the first term.

title: Neuroscience
summary: The MSc by Research in Neuroscience at the University of Bristol is a one-year research-focused program designed to deepen knowledge in neuroscience and develop independent research skills. Students will work on a research project under the guidance of world-leading experts, preparing them for potential PhD studies or careers in life sciences. The program emphasizes practical research experience without a formal taught component.
requirements: Minimum 2:2 BSc Honours degree in neuroscience, psychology, biomedical sciences, or a related subject. Evidence of research aptitude is required, such as an undergraduate research project. Non-traditional backgrounds may be considered with relevant experience.
structure: The program involves one academic year embedded in a research group, focusing on a specific research project. There is no formal taught component, but students can attend events for personal and professional development, culminating in an MScR thesis.

title: MSc Cardiovascular Perfusion (Online)
summary: The MSc in Cardiovascular Perfusion (Online) offers a research-led education aimed at enhancing knowledge and critical awareness of cardiovascular medicine and perfusion science. It is designed for practising perfusionists and culminates in a novel research project. The program includes training in academic skills, advanced physiology, and the principles of perfusion techniques.
fees: Home: £7,400 per year, Overseas: £7,400 per year
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in a medicine-related, clinical or bioscience subject, including nursing and perfusion-related subjects. Relevant work experience or a postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The program is delivered part-time online over 2 years, consisting of six mandatory taught units and a research project.

title: MSc Climate Change Science and Policy
summary: The MSc in Climate Change Science and Policy at the University of Bristol equips students with a solid foundation in climate change science and policy-making. The program emphasizes hands-on training with climate models and data, fostering skills in quantitative analysis, programming, and science communication. It prepares graduates for careers in various sectors addressing the climate emergency, including government, business, and research.
requirements: Typically requires an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in relevant fields such as Biology, Chemistry, Earth Sciences, Environmental Sciences, Engineering, Geography, Mathematics, or Physics. Applicants should demonstrate experience in Programming, Modelling, or Applied Data Analysis. Two years of relevant work experience may also be considered.
structure: The program consists of six taught units and a dissertation project. Taught units cover climate change science, impacts, and quantitative analysis, with optional units available for further training in statistics, GIS, or environmental models.
careers: UK Centre for Ecology and Hydrology

title: MSc Clinical Neuropsychology
summary: The MSc in Clinical Neuropsychology at the University of Bristol is a BPS-accredited program designed to enhance the skills of clinicians and support their entry onto the Specialist Register of Clinical Neuropsychologists (SRCN). The course offers both adult and paediatric pathways, with a strong emphasis on practical experience and research competencies. It is largely delivered online, allowing flexibility for students while ensuring they meet the necessary clinical practice standards.
requirements: Typically, applicants must be registered with the Health and Care Professions Council (HCPC) as a practitioner in Clinical or Counselling psychology. Those with Forensic or Health specialisms will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Applicants must also demonstrate research competencies and, if applicable, Generic Competencies in Clinical Neuropsychology.
structure: The program consists of taught content delivered within five units and a clinical practice component. Key units include Applied Clinical Neuropsychology, Issues in Clinical Neuropsychology, Theoretical Neuropsychology, Neurorehabilitation, and Evidence Based Neuropsychology. The clinical practice component culminates in a portfolio demonstrating BPS competencies.

title: MSc Clinical Perfusion Science
summary: The MSc in Clinical Perfusion Science is a blended learning program that combines academic knowledge with practical training for clinical perfusion scientists. It prepares students for professional registration with the Society of Clinical Perfusion Scientists of Great Britain and Ireland (SCPS) and covers advanced physiology, disease states, and research skills relevant to perfusion science. The program requires students to secure a trainee position at an accredited hospital training center.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in a science or medicine-related subject is required. Applicants must secure a Clinical Perfusion Scientist trainee position at an accredited training center in Great Britain or Ireland.
structure: The program consists of six taught units, including work-based clinical practice and assessment, and a research project. Students attend intensive study weeks in Bristol four times a year, combined with distance learning weeks.

title: MSc Clinical Research Methods and Evidence-Based Medicine

structure: Check website

title: MSc Communication Networks and Signal Processing
summary: The MSc in Communication Networks and Signal Processing at the University of Bristol is an intensive one-year program aimed at graduates aspiring to innovate in next-generation communication technologies such as 5G/6G wireless and quantum communications. The curriculum combines theoretical knowledge with practical skills, culminating in a substantial capstone project that addresses real-world challenges. Students benefit from hands-on experience and research led by experts in the field, preparing them for impactful careers in industry and academia.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in relevant fields such as Communications Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related disciplines. Additional qualifications may be considered.
structure: The program comprises six core units followed by a substantial capstone project that begins after the second term and concludes in the summer, allowing students to apply their learning to real-world problems.

title: MSc Computer Science (Conversion)
summary: The MSc Computer Science (Conversion) programme at the University of Bristol is designed for students from diverse academic backgrounds with little or no prior computing experience. It aims to provide a solid foundation in computer science principles, software development methods, and industrial practices. Students will engage in individual and group projects, culminating in a summer project and dissertation.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in a non-computer science subject is required. Applicants must demonstrate suitable mathematical skills, either through a mathematics unit in their degree or a Grade B/Grade 6 or above in GCSE Maths (or equivalent).
structure: The programme is divided into two teaching blocks and a summer project. The first block focuses on imperative programming and computer architecture, while the second block emphasizes industrial-style tools and techniques for software development and web applications.

title: MSc Conflict Resolution and Peacebuilding
summary: The MSc in Conflict Resolution and Peacebuilding is an interdisciplinary program that equips students with the skills to address the complexities of violent conflict through political, social, economic, legal, and psychological lenses. It emphasizes innovative practices in conflict transformation and peacebuilding, engaging students in simulation exercises, guest lectures, and internships. Graduates are prepared for leadership roles in various sectors, tackling contemporary challenges in conflict and peacebuilding.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Relevant work experience in sectors such as Law, Human Rights, Public Affairs, Political Affairs, Psychology, or Journalism (minimum of twelve months) or a postgraduate qualification in any discipline may also be considered.
structure: The program includes a combination of mandatory and optional taught units delivered over 12 weeks, followed by a dissertation unit.

title: MSc Cyber Security (Infrastructures Security)
summary: The MSc Cyber Security (Infrastructures Security) program at the University of Bristol focuses on equipping students with the skills to tackle global cyber threats specific to large-scale infrastructures. It combines rigorous research with hands-on experience in real-world environments, preparing graduates to analyze and mitigate cyber security risks. The program emphasizes critical thinking and multi-dimensional problem-solving in the context of cyber security.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in Computer Science, Electrical or Electronic Engineering, Cyber Security, Network Security, or Information Security is required. Relevant modules must be studied at a minimum of 60%. Work experience may also be considered.
structure: The MSc consists of compulsory units including Foundations of Cyber Security, Network Security, and Security of Industrial Control Systems. Students will undertake an individual research project, with units taught in intensive week-long blocks.

title: MSc Cyber Security (Software Security)
summary: The MSc Cyber Security (Software Security) program at the University of Bristol focuses on equipping students with the skills to address modern software security challenges. It emphasizes hands-on experience and rigorous research, preparing graduates to mitigate cyber threats in complex software systems. The course is delivered at the new Temple Quarter Enterprise Campus, fostering industry collaboration.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in Computer Science, Electrical or Electronic Engineering, Cyber Security, Information Security, or Software Engineering is required. Relevant modules must be studied, and applicants with lower grades may be considered with significant work experience.
structure: The MSc consists of compulsory units in cyber security, network security, systems security, software security analysis, and secure software engineering. Students will undertake an individual research project and units are taught in intensive week-long blocks.

title: MSc Data Science
summary: The MSc in Data Science at the University of Bristol equips students with the skills to responsibly use data to address real-world challenges. The program covers computational, machine learning, and statistical principles, emphasizing ethical applications and project management. It prepares graduates for roles in industry as data scientists or data engineers, as well as for research and development positions.
requirements: Typically, a strong upper second-class honours degree (65% or higher) or an international equivalent in a Numerate Science, Computer Science, or Engineering is required. Other acceptable subjects include Accounting, Architecture, Astrophysics, Biology, Chemistry, Econometrics, Economics, Finance, Genetics, Geology, Medicine, Neuroscience, Operations Research, Physics, and Psychology.
structure: The MSc consists of units in Software Development or Statistical Computing, Large-Scale Data Engineering, Technology, Innovation, Business, and Society, Introduction to Artificial Intelligence and Text Analytics, Visual Analytics, and Data Science Methods and Practice. An individual or group project is also included.

title: MSc Data Science for Business
summary: The MSc Data Science for Business is an interdisciplinary program at the University of Bristol that combines business and engineering principles to prepare graduates for a data-driven world. Over one year of full-time study, students will learn to manage and analyze large datasets while developing digital skills applicable in various business contexts. The curriculum allows for specializations in areas such as Sustainability, Marketing, Supply Chain Management, or Finance, and includes practical experience through industry links and consulting projects.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in a quantitative subject is required. A-level Mathematics with grade A is acceptable if no quantitative units are included in the degree. Relevant work experience or a postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The program includes core units covering data science principles and business fundamentals, with focus units for specialization in areas like Sustainability, Marketing, Supply Chain Management, or Finance. An applied research project is also part of the curriculum.

title: MSc Dental Implantology
summary: The MSc Dental Implantology is a three-year, part-time program designed for dental practitioners aiming to enhance their skills in implant dentistry. It combines theoretical teaching with hands-on clinical experience, allowing students to treat their own implant cases. The course culminates in a dissertation in the third year, focusing on a topic of the student's choice related to dental implants.
requirements: Typically, a Bachelor of Dental Surgery or an equivalent UK General Dental Council-registrable dental qualification is required, along with at least one year of post-graduation work experience in dentistry. Applicants must hold full or temporary registration with the UK General Dental Council.
structure: Years 1 and 2 consist of three units each, including two theory-based modules and one clinical module. Year 3 focuses on completing a dissertation related to dental implants.
careers: Dental practitioners specializing in implant dentistry

title: MSc Development and Security
summary: The MSc in Development and Security at the University of Bristol explores the relationship between development and security, focusing on how societies can achieve equitable growth amidst global challenges. The program emphasizes critical analysis of contemporary conflicts, theoretical debates, and practical case studies, preparing graduates for careers in diplomacy, humanitarian work, and policy analysis. Students will engage with leading scholars and undertake a research project to refine their analytical skills.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline. Relevant work experience or a postgraduate qualification may strengthen your application.
structure: The program includes a combination of mandatory and optional taught units, assessed by essays, followed by a dissertation in the summer term.

title: MSc East Asian Development and the Global Economy
summary: The MSc in East Asian Development and the Global Economy offers an advanced exploration of East Asia's transformation and its impact on global affairs. The program examines political, economic, and social changes in the region, focusing on trade, finance, and investment flows. Students engage with theories of international political economy and develop critical analytical skills through discussions and a dissertation project.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Relevant work experience in sectors like NGOs or government departments may also be considered.
structure: The program includes a combination of mandatory and optional taught units, assessed by essays, followed by a dissertation in the summer term.

title: MSc Economics
summary: The MSc Economics program at the University of Bristol is an intensive one-year course designed for graduates in economics or quantitative disciplines. It offers advanced training in economics with specialist pathways in economics, economic policy, or macroeconomics, preparing students for careers in both private and public sectors. The program incorporates cutting-edge research and provides a collaborative academic environment.
requirements: An upper second-class honours degree or equivalent in a quantitative subject, or a 2:1 in at least three different quantitative units. A-level Mathematics with grade A is required if no quantitative units are in the degree. Relevant work experience or a postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The program consists of compulsory units in the first term, optional units in the second term, and a dissertation in the final term. There are three exit degrees available: MSc Economics, MSc Economics (Macroeconomics), and MSc Economics (Economic Policy).
careers: UK Department of Health and Social Care

title: MSc Economics and Finance
summary: The MSc Economics and Finance program at the University of Bristol is designed for graduates in economics, finance, or quantitative disciplines. It combines advanced training in economics and econometrics with finance expertise, preparing students for careers in the banking industry or financial sector. The program allows for tailored study through optional units and includes a dissertation to develop analytical and research skills.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in a quantitative subject is required. A-level Mathematics with grade A is acceptable if no quantitative units are in the degree. Relevant work experience or qualifications may also be considered.
structure: The program includes core units and three additional optional units, culminating in a project-based dissertation of up to 15,000 words.

title: MSc Economics with Data Science
summary: The MSc Economics with Data Science at the University of Bristol offers an interdisciplinary approach, combining economics, econometrics, and data science. It is designed for both professionals and recent graduates with a quantitative background, providing practical training in programming and data science software. Students will engage in real-world problem-solving through a dissertation project, often in collaboration with industry partners.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or equivalent in a quantitative subject such as Economics, Computer Science, or Mathematics is required. A-level Mathematics with grade A is also acceptable if no quantitative units are included in the degree. Relevant work experience or a postgraduate qualification may strengthen the application.
structure: The first term includes compulsory units in economics and data science, while the second term allows for optional units alongside a mandatory Machine Learning for Economics unit. Students will also work on an applied research project, potentially with industry partners.
careers: UK Ministry of Housing, Communities & Local Government

title: MSc Economics, Finance and Management
summary: The MSc Economics, Finance and Management program at the University of Bristol is designed for graduates from all degree backgrounds with some quantitative experience. It offers comprehensive training across business-relevant disciplines, focusing on real-world applications to tackle strategic challenges in competitive markets. Students can specialize in Business and Strategy or International Economics and Finance, tailoring their studies to their career aspirations.
requirements: An upper second class honours degree or international equivalent in a quantitative subject, or evidence of an upper second-class honours degree with three mathematics units. A-Level Mathematics with grade A is acceptable if no quantitative units are included in the degree.
structure: The program includes core units in economics, finance, and management in the first term, followed by optional units or specializations in Business and Strategy or International Economics and Finance.

title: MSc Education (Inclusive Education)
summary: The MSc Education at the University of Bristol is designed for graduates who wish to specialize in a specific area within education or create a tailored program of study. Students can choose from eight specialisms or combine units from different areas, culminating in a supervised research dissertation. The program fosters a rich learning environment and prepares graduates for various roles in education and research.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Applications may be considered with slightly lower interim grades or if a relevant postgraduate qualification is held.
structure: The program includes a mandatory unit on educational research inquiry and methods in Year 1, followed by specialization units and optional units in Year 2. Students complete a supervised research dissertation project in an educational area of interest.
careers: Policy influencers in government bodies and education charities

title: MSc Education (Leadership and Policy)
summary: The MSc Education at the University of Bristol is designed for graduates who wish to specialize in a specific area within education or create a tailored program of study. Students can choose from eight specialisms or combine units from different areas, culminating in a supervised research dissertation. The program fosters a diverse learning environment and prepares graduates for various roles in education.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Applications may be considered with slightly lower interim grades or if a relevant postgraduate qualification is held.
structure: The program includes a mandatory unit on educational research inquiry and methods in Year 1, followed by specialization units and optional units in Year 2. The master's concludes with a supervised research dissertation project.
careers: Policy influencers in government bodies and education charities

summary: The MSc Education at the University of Bristol is designed for graduates who wish to specialize in a specific area within education or create a tailored program of study. Students can choose from eight specialisms or combine units from different areas, fostering a rich learning environment. The program prepares graduates for various roles in education, research, and policy.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Applications may be considered with slightly lower interim grades or if a relevant postgraduate qualification is held.
structure: The program includes a mandatory unit on educational research inquiry and methods, followed by specialization in chosen units and optional units from other specialisms. It culminates in a supervised research dissertation project.

summary: The MSc Education at the University of Bristol is designed for graduates who wish to specialize in a specific area within education or create a tailored program of study. Students can choose from eight specialisms or combine units from different areas, culminating in a supervised research dissertation. The program fosters a diverse learning environment and prepares graduates for various roles in education.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Applications may be considered with slightly lower interim grades or if a relevant postgraduate qualification is held.
structure: The program includes a mandatory unit on educational research inquiry and methods in Year 1, followed by specialization units and optional units in Year 2. The master's concludes with a supervised research dissertation.
careers: Policy influencers in government bodies and education charities

title: MSc Engineering Mathematics
summary: The MSc in Engineering Mathematics at the University of Bristol focuses on applying mathematical and engineering principles to solve complex real-world problems across various fields, including artificial intelligence, ecology, and biomedicine. The program is designed for graduates from related disciplines and emphasizes multidisciplinary problem-solving through collaboration with industry. Graduates are well-prepared for careers in high-tech innovation and various sectors.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree (or international equivalent) in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Physics is required. Applicants with a degree in Chemistry may be considered on a case-by-case basis. Biology or non-STEM degrees are not suitable.
structure: The program includes taught units organized around engineering, computational science, and mathematical/statistical training, with a focus on real-world problem-solving. Students will complete an MSc thesis during the summer term after finishing the taught units.

title: MSc Engineering with Management
summary: The MSc Engineering with Management program at the University of Bristol is a one-year full-time course designed for recent graduates and professionals looking to enhance their engineering background with management and leadership skills. It offers four specialist pathways: Intelligent Manufacturing, Energy for Sustainability, Infrastructure Systems, and Project Management, focusing on real-world challenges and the integration of technology, business, and sustainability.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in a relevant engineering discipline is required. Applicants from various disciplines with relevant knowledge are welcome, and work experience may be considered.
structure: The program includes core units on Strategic Business Management, Engineering Design and Technology, Systems Risk Management, and a Programme Level Assessment, culminating in a supervised research-based dissertation project.

title: MSc Environmental Analytical Chemistry
summary: The MSc in Environmental Analytical Chemistry at the University of Bristol focuses on training students in advanced analytical techniques to address critical environmental issues such as pollution and climate change. The program combines practical laboratory experience with data analysis and communication skills, preparing graduates for diverse careers in science and engineering. Students will engage in a research project aligned with ongoing environmental chemistry research, enhancing their expertise in the field.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree (or international equivalent) in Engineering or Natural/Physical Sciences such as Chemistry, Earth Science, Environmental Sciences, etc. Applicants must demonstrate competency in Maths and Chemistry through GCSEs, A-levels, or relevant undergraduate modules.
structure: The program consists of five compulsory units and a project with a dissertation. Assessments include multiple-choice tests, reports, presentations, and a project lasting three months.
careers: Instrument development in the industrial sector
Careers in environmental science (e.g., national environment agencies, private consultancies)
Training and teaching in data analysis

title: MSc Environmental Modelling and Data Analysis
summary: The MSc in Environmental Modelling and Data Analysis equips students with skills to understand environmental systems through numerical models and satellite Earth observation. The program covers various areas including climate change, flooding, and land use, while emphasizing practical coding skills in scientific programming and high-performance computing. Students will engage in hands-on learning and research, culminating in a dissertation that allows for original research in environmental modelling.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in Engineering, Mathematics, or a Physical Science subject is required. Applicants with non-standard degrees must have achieved 60% in relevant modules such as Environmental Modelling, Remote Sensing, or GIS. Relevant work experience or a postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The program includes mandatory units that introduce key ideas and techniques, leading to a dissertation in the summer. Students will learn Python and R for environmental data science and have the option to choose units that align with their research interests.

title: MSc Environmental Policy and Management
summary: The MSc in Environmental Policy and Management prepares students for careers in shaping policy on environmental change. It equips students with practical skills and conceptual tools to address issues such as biodiversity conservation, water management, and air pollution. The program is affiliated with the Cabot Institute and emphasizes multidisciplinary research and practice-based learning.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in relevant fields such as Environmental Science, Geography, Politics, or related disciplines. Applicants with other degrees may be considered with relevant work experience. English language proficiency is required for non-native speakers.
structure: The program consists of six taught units and a dissertation research project. It includes both natural and social science perspectives, with a focus on environmental governance and policy analysis.

title: MSc Epidemiology
summary: The MSc in Epidemiology at the University of Bristol focuses on the study of disease and health outcomes in populations, aiming to identify causes of illness and promote public health. The program provides high-quality training in epidemiological methods applicable across various income settings and is suitable for students from both clinical and non-clinical backgrounds. Students will engage in research, culminating in a dissertation presented as a journal article and poster.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in a relevant subject such as medicine, veterinary science, or public health is required. Evidence of numeracy skills is needed if the degree is not in medicine or veterinary science. Relevant work experience or a postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The program includes compulsory units and a dissertation undertaken in the final term and summer. Teaching methods involve lectures, practicals, group work, and workshops, with a focus on statistical analysis using the R package.
careers: Academic (lecturer, senior lecturer, professor of epidemiology)
Director of research and development in pharmaceutical companies

title: MSc Finance and Investment
summary: The MSc Finance and Investment at the University of Bristol is a comprehensive program that combines theoretical foundations with practical applications in modern finance. It covers core areas such as asset pricing and corporate finance, while allowing students to tailor their learning through various optional units. The program emphasizes applied learning with hands-on experience using professional financial tools and includes a financial markets simulation.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in a quantitative subject such as Accounting and Finance, Economics, Engineering, or Mathematics is required. A-level Mathematics with grade A is acceptable if no quantitative units are in the degree. Relevant work experience may also be considered.
structure: The program is delivered over one year, with compulsory units in the first semester and optional units in the second semester, culminating in a research-based dissertation.

title: MSc Financial Technology
summary: The MSc in Financial Technology at the University of Bristol provides a comprehensive grounding in analytical methods of financial technology, integrating finance theory with practical applications. The program covers technological advancements in finance, including big data, AI, and blockchain, while equipping students with programming and statistical analysis skills. Students will engage in applied projects with industry partners and have the opportunity to conduct original research through a dissertation.
requirements: Upper second class honours degree or international equivalent in a quantitative subject such as Accounting, Computer Science, Economics, or Mathematics. Alternatively, an upper second-class degree with three units of mathematics at 60% or above, or A-level Mathematics with grade A.
structure: The program includes compulsory units in asset pricing, corporate finance, and quantitative techniques in Year 1, with optional modules in Year 2 focusing on specific finance sub-areas. A dissertation allows for original research related to finance or financial technology.

title: MSc Financial Technology with Data Science
summary: The MSc Financial Technology with Data Science at the University of Bristol prepares students to engage with the financial technology revolution by teaching key design features of financial technology applications and developing skills in data analysis, machine learning, and engineering. The program is technology-focused and aims to equip graduates with the necessary skills for careers in data-driven finance and technology, with opportunities for real-world industry engagement.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in a Numerate Science, Computer Science, or Engineering is required. Acceptable degrees include Accounting, Aeronautical Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, Biology, Chemistry, Mathematics, and more. Relevant work experience or additional qualifications may also be considered.
structure: The program includes foundational units based on prior experience, followed by compulsory units such as Large-Scale Data Engineering and Advanced Financial Technology. Students will complete an individual research or implementation project to integrate their learning.

title: MSc Gender and International Relations
summary: The MSc in Gender and International Relations offers a comprehensive examination of how gender influences and is influenced by global politics. The program integrates feminist, gender, cultural, and sexuality studies with international political economy and security, equipping students with the analytical tools to critique foreign policy and understand power dynamics. Students will engage in independent research and benefit from a diverse academic community, preparing them for careers in diplomacy, advocacy, and development.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Relevant work experience or a postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The program includes a combination of mandatory and optional taught units, followed by a dissertation in the summer term.

title: MSc Geographic Data Science and Spatial Analytics
summary: The MSc in Geographic Data Science and Spatial Analytics at the University of Bristol equips students with the skills to analyze spatial data using advanced data science tools and methods. It is designed for individuals from diverse academic backgrounds, focusing on applications in city science, policymaking, and environmental management. The program emphasizes responsible use of AI and machine learning to address societal and environmental challenges.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in any subject is required. Applicants must have achieved a minimum of 60% in at least one relevant module such as Applied Statistics, Mathematics, or Geographic Information Systems. Relevant work experience or qualifications may also be considered.
structure: The program follows a data science workflow from data collection to analysis and visualization, focusing on AI methods, machine learning models, and geographic theories with applications in various fields.

title: MSc Global Development and Environment
summary: The MSc Global Development and Environment program at the University of Bristol addresses the evolving concepts of development in relation to environmental issues, focusing on global sustainable development. It aims to equip graduates with interdisciplinary knowledge and practical skills to tackle contemporary global challenges such as climate change, migration, and resource management. Students will engage with real-world policy challenges and explore the interplay between environmental and developmental concerns.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or equivalent in relevant fields such as Biology, Geography, Politics, or professional degrees. Consideration for applicants with other degrees if they have relevant work experience in policy-facing roles or environmental consultancies.
structure: The program includes a foundational unit on Global Development and Environment, a policy-focused unit, and a core unit on Sustainability, Risk and Resilience. Students can choose three additional units on various topics, with group work and presentations required.

summary: The MSc in Global Wildlife Health and Conservation is a unique program that combines theoretical knowledge and practical experience in wildlife conservation and health. title: MSc Health Economics and Health Policy Analysis
summary: The MSc in Health Economics and Health Policy Analysis at the University of Bristol equips students with the skills to apply economic and policy theory to improve resource use and service delivery in health systems. The program focuses on real-world challenges such as inequalities and climate change, teaching analytical techniques and research methods used by health economists and policy analysts. title: MSc Immersive Technologies (Virtual and Augmented Reality)
summary: The MSc in Immersive Technologies (Virtual and Augmented Reality) at the University of Bristol prepares students to create engaging immersive content and interactive experiences across various industries. The program combines technical skills with critical theory and practical applications, emphasizing collaboration with industry partners. Students will learn from leading academics and gain insights into the evolving immersive technology sector.

title: MSc Innovation and Entrepreneurship
summary: The MSc in Innovation and Entrepreneurship at the University of Bristol is designed for future leaders aiming to launch startups or drive change within corporations. The program emphasizes practical, hands-on learning through real-world projects, equipping students with essential entrepreneurial skills. Students will explore the use of AI in strategic leadership and benefit from a curriculum that fosters innovation in a collaborative environment.

Designers and Strategists in global firms
