title: MSc International Development
summary: The MSc International Development program at the University of Bristol is designed for current and aspiring practitioners and thinkers addressing global development challenges. It combines academic inquiry with policy-oriented analysis, focusing on the evolution of development concepts, planning processes, and policy delivery. Students engage with core units on conflict, security, and development, culminating in an independent dissertation that allows for in-depth exploration of specific issues.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Relevant work experience in sectors like NGOs or government departments may also be considered.
structure: The program includes a combination of mandatory and optional taught units, followed by a dissertation in the summer term.

title: MSc International Relations
summary: The MSc in International Relations at the University of Bristol offers a comprehensive exploration of contemporary global politics, combining theoretical training with case analysis. Students will engage with key debates in the field, develop analytical skills, and tailor their studies through optional units. The program emphasizes the interconnections between domestic and international issues, preparing graduates for impactful careers in various sectors.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Applications may be considered with slightly lower interim grades or if a relevant postgraduate qualification is held.
structure: The program includes a combination of mandatory and optional taught units, assessed by essays or equivalent submissions, followed by a dissertation in the summer term.

title: MSc International Security
summary: The MSc in International Security at the University of Bristol explores the complex threats and challenges in today's world, including conflicts, climate crises, and organized crime. The program combines theoretical and empirical tools, allowing students to analyze security issues and develop evidence-based positions. Students engage with internationally recognized scholars and have the opportunity to produce a dissertation under dedicated supervision.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Relevant work experience or a postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The program includes a combination of mandatory and optional taught units, assessed by essays or equivalent submissions, followed by a dissertation in the summer term.

title: MSc Internet of Things with AI
summary: The MSc in Internet of Things with AI at the University of Bristol focuses on developing expertise in building and deploying advanced IoT systems powered by machine learning algorithms. The program combines theoretical knowledge with practical exercises, emphasizing ethical data management and preparing students for diverse roles in industries such as smart urban development and healthcare.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in relevant subjects such as Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, or Electronic Engineering is required. Applicants with a minimum score of 60% in specific engineering and numerate science modules may also be considered.
structure: The program offers a comprehensive educational experience combining structured learning with independent self-study, focusing on critical thinking, problem-solving, and practical application throughout the course.

title: MSc Interpreting
summary: The MSc Interpreting at the University of Bristol is designed for applicants with high proficiency in English and Mandarin, focusing on developing a versatile skill set for professional interpreting and related fields. The program includes training in various interpreting techniques, business fundamentals, and advanced communication models, preparing students for roles in diverse environments from international diplomacy to business. Students can specialize in different areas during their studies, supported by personal tutoring and practical experiences.
fees: Home: £13,500 per year, Overseas: £32,500 per year
requirements: For native Chinese speakers: upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in any subject. For non-native speakers: upper second-class honours degree in Chinese Studies or similar, or completion of a full program at a prestigious Chinese institution. Non-traditional qualifications may be considered.
structure: The first semester covers core units in practical translation and interpreting skills, technological and business fluency, and the role of language professionals. The second semester includes Simultaneous Interpreting and Augmented Intelligence Technologies, with options to specialize further.

title: MSc Management
summary: The MSc Management program at the University of Bristol is a one-year intensive course designed for ambitious graduates from any academic background, focusing on Leadership, Strategy, and Change. It aims to equip students with a critical understanding of management principles and the skills necessary to lead effectively in complex organizational environments. The program emphasizes hands-on learning through real-life case studies and collaborative projects, preparing students for leadership roles across various industries.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Relevant work experience (5 years minimum) in fields such as Business Management, Finance, Marketing, or Project Management may also be considered.
structure: The program includes five core units and a specialist unit in Leadership, Strategy, and Change. Core units cover Management and Organisation, Strategy, Finance and Accounting for Management, Operations and Marketing Management, Management Research Methods, and Academic, Personal and Professional Development.

title: MSc Management (CSR and Sustainability)
summary: The MSc Management with a specialism in Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) and Sustainability is a one-year intensive program designed for graduates from diverse backgrounds. It focuses on developing management skills and understanding responsible business conduct, preparing students for management-level roles in CSR and sustainability. The program includes engagement with external organizations and practical applications of management theory.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline. Relevant work experience (5 years minimum) in fields such as Business Management, Finance, Marketing, Operations, or a relevant postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The program includes five core units and a specialist unit in Corporate Social Responsibility and Sustainability. Core units cover management fundamentals, finance, operations, and marketing, with opportunities for applied projects and research in the final part.

title: MSc Management (Digitalisation and Big Data)
summary: The MSc Management (Digitalisation and Big Data) is a one-year intensive program designed for graduates from diverse backgrounds who aspire to management and leadership roles in digital environments. The course covers management theories and practices, focusing on digitalisation and big data, and aims to develop analytical and critical thinking skills through practical applications and group work. Students will engage with real-world case studies and have opportunities for in-depth research tailored to their career goals.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Relevant work experience (5 years minimum) in fields such as Business Management, Finance, Marketing, Operations, or a relevant postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The program includes five core units and a specialist unit on Digitalisation, Big Data, and Value Creation. Core units cover Management, Strategy, Finance, Operations, and Research Methods, with opportunities for in-depth research through an academic dissertation, applied project, or group project focused on sustainability.

title: MSc Management (Entrepreneurship and Innovation)
summary: The MSc Management with a specialism in Entrepreneurship and Innovation at the University of Bristol is a one-year intensive program designed for graduates from diverse backgrounds. It focuses on developing entrepreneurial skills and management techniques applicable to various industries, preparing students for leadership roles in innovation and business. The course emphasizes critical thinking, ethical considerations, and practical applications through group work and real-world case studies.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Relevant work experience (5 years minimum) in fields such as Business Management, Finance, Marketing, or a relevant postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The program consists of five core units worth 90 credit points and a specialist unit in Entrepreneurship and Innovation worth 30 credit points. Core subjects include Management and Organisation, Strategy, Finance and Accounting for Management, Operations and Marketing Management, and Research Methods.

title: MSc Management (International Business)
summary: The MSc Management with a specialism in International Business is a one-year intensive program designed for graduates from diverse academic backgrounds. It prepares students for management and leadership roles in international organizations, focusing on the complexities of global business and the application of management theories. The program emphasizes critical thinking, ethical considerations, and practical applications through group work and real-world case studies.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Relevant work experience (5 years minimum) in fields such as Business Management, Finance, Marketing, or a relevant postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The program includes core units in Management, Strategy, Finance, Operations, and Marketing, with a specialized unit in International Business. The final part allows for in-depth research through an academic dissertation, applied project, or group project focused on management knowledge and sustainability.

title: MSc Management (International Human Resource Management)
summary: The MSc Management with a specialism in International Human Resource Management is a one-year intensive program designed for graduates from diverse academic backgrounds. It focuses on developing management and leadership skills in an international HRM context, emphasizing critical thinking, ethical considerations, and practical application through case studies and group projects. Students will gain insights into management theory and practice, preparing them for careers in various industries.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Relevant work experience (5 years minimum) or a relevant postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The program includes five core units and a specialist unit in International HRM. Core units cover Management and Organisation, Strategy, Finance and Accounting for Management, Operations and Marketing Management, Management Research Methods, and Academic, Personal and Professional Development.

title: MSc Management (Marketing)
summary: The MSc Management (Marketing) is a one-year intensive program designed for graduates from diverse backgrounds who aspire to management and leadership roles in marketing. It provides a comprehensive understanding of marketing theories and practices, consumer behavior, and ethical issues, while emphasizing practical application through group work and real-world case studies. The program aims to develop critical thinking and analytical skills necessary for addressing contemporary organizational challenges.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Relevant work experience (5 years minimum) or a relevant postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The program includes core units in Management and Organisation, Strategy, Finance and Accounting for Management, Operations and Marketing Management, Management Research Methods, and Academic, Personal and Professional Development. The specialist unit focuses on Contemporary and Emerging Issues in Marketing Management, with options for an academic dissertation, applied extended project, or group project in the final part.

title: MSc Management (Project Management)
summary: The MSc Management with a specialism in Project Management is a one-year intensive program designed for graduates from diverse backgrounds, aiming to prepare them for management and leadership roles in various industries. The course emphasizes critical analysis and practical application of management theories, particularly in project management, through group work, case studies, and research projects. Students will develop skills in teamwork, communication, and ethical engagement with global challenges.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Relevant work experience (5 years minimum) or a relevant postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The program includes core courses in finance, accounting, organisational behaviour, and strategic management in the first term, followed by operations and marketing management in the second term. The final part involves an in-depth research project aligned with student interests.

title: MSc Marketing
summary: The MSc Marketing programme at the University of Bristol is designed for graduates aiming for advanced study and careers in marketing. It offers specializations in marketing strategy or digital marketing, and prepares students for industry-recognized qualifications from CIM and IDM. The course combines academic theory with practical application, equipping students to tackle contemporary marketing challenges in a global business environment.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Relevant work experience (minimum five years) or a relevant postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The programme consists of four core units, two optional units, and a final project. Students can choose between a theoretical issue or an applied industry project for their final work.

title: MSc Mathematical Sciences
summary: The MSc in Mathematical Sciences at the University of Bristol is a flexible and challenging program designed to develop a wide range of mathematical techniques. Taught by leading experts, it offers a choice of units and culminates in a research project, equipping graduates with strong analytical and communication skills for further research or high-level employment.
requirements: Typically, a strong upper second-class honours degree (65% or higher) or an international equivalent in Mathematics or a closely related subject is required. Joint honours degrees with sufficient theoretical mathematics content may also be considered.
structure: The program comprises a taught component and a research project, with a wide range of unit combinations available. An academic mentor will guide unit selection and support students throughout the taught component.

title: MSc Medical Statistics and Health Data Science
summary: The MSc in Medical Statistics and Health Data Science at the University of Bristol equips students with the skills to tackle complex healthcare challenges through statistical and data science methods. The program emphasizes training in statistical research, data analysis, and effective communication of findings, preparing graduates for impactful roles in improving population health. With a strong focus on real-life case studies, students will develop both quantitative and professional skills essential for success in the field.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or equivalent in relevant fields such as Mathematics, Statistics, or Engineering is required. A-level Mathematics (or equivalent) at grade A or above is also needed, or three quantitative modules at 60% or above, plus A-level Mathematics at grade C or above.
structure: The program includes lectures, practicals, group work, and workshops, with a compulsory dissertation formatted as a journal article. Part-time study requires attendance on specific weekdays.

title: MSc Molecular Neuroscience
summary: The MSc Molecular Neuroscience program at the University of Bristol focuses on understanding the brain's functioning in health and disease. It covers molecular mechanisms related to neurodegeneration and mental health, combining theoretical knowledge with practical research experience. The program is designed for graduates aiming to pursue PhD studies or careers in various fields related to neuroscience.
requirements: Typically, an upper second class honours degree or international equivalent in biomedical sciences, life sciences, health sciences, biology, chemistry, medicine, neuroscience, psychology, or related disciplines. Relevant work experience or postgraduate qualifications may also be considered.
structure: The program is a one-year full-time course consisting of six taught units and a research project, covering topics such as cell signalling, genomics, neurodegenerative diseases, and research methods.

title: MSc Nuclear Science and Engineering
summary: The MSc in Nuclear Science and Engineering at the University of Bristol prepares students for careers in the nuclear industry or academia, focusing on the science and engineering of nuclear fission and fusion energy. The program combines theoretical knowledge with practical experience, including a research placement and collaboration with industry partners. Graduates will be equipped with the skills needed to meet the growing demand in the nuclear sector.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree (or international equivalent) in an Engineering or Science discipline is required. Applicants must demonstrate mathematical knowledge through A-level Mathematics (Grade C or above) or equivalent coursework in quantitative subjects.
structure: The program is delivered full-time over one year, including core units on Nuclear Science, Nuclear Reactor Engineering, and practical work involving a three-month research placement and a group project.

title: MSc Nutrition, Physical Activity and Public Health
summary: The MSc in Nutrition, Physical Activity and Public Health at the University of Bristol focuses on the interconnected fields of nutrition, physical activity, and public health to address non-communicable diseases. The program emphasizes research, policy, and practical skills, preparing graduates for roles that require critical thinking and evaluation of health interventions. It is suitable for graduates and professionals interested in advancing their careers in these areas.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any subject is required. Relevant work experience or a postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The program is delivered over one year full-time or two years part-time, with all units being compulsory and assessed through written assignments, presentations, and a dissertation.

title: MSc Optical Communications and Signal Processing
summary: The MSc in Optical Communications and Signal Processing at the University of Bristol prepares students for high-impact careers in telecommunications, optical networks, and photonics. The program combines advanced theoretical knowledge with hands-on experience in state-of-the-art labs, covering topics such as optical fibre technology and quantum photonics. Students will engage in a substantial capstone project to apply their learning to real-world challenges.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in relevant fields such as Communications Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Physics is required. Other Engineering degrees may be considered with a minimum score of 60% in specific modules.
structure: The program comprises six core units followed by a substantial capstone project that starts after the second term and completes during the summer.

title: MSc Optoelectronic and Quantum Technologies
summary: The MSc in Optoelectronic and Quantum Technologies at the University of Bristol focuses on the design, fabrication, and application of integrated circuits and systems that merge optics, electronics, and quantum engineering. Students will gain hands-on experience in world-leading labs and develop skills applicable in communications, computing, sensing, and healthcare. The program prepares graduates for careers in cutting-edge quantum technology fields.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in relevant fields such as Chemistry, Computer Science, Electronic Engineering, Mathematics, or Physics. Consideration for applicants with slightly lower grades if they have relevant work experience or qualifications.
structure: The program comprises core units followed by an engineering project starting in the second term and completed during the summer.

title: MSc Oral Medicine
summary: The MSc in Oral Medicine is a one-year, full-time program designed for qualified dental clinicians to enhance their skills in clinical oral medicine. It emphasizes the diagnosis and management of oral and maxillofacial diseases while integrating evidence-based medicine principles. Students will engage in supervised clinical experiences and complete a dissertation, supported by high staff-to-student ratios.
requirements: Typically requires a Bachelor of Dental Surgery or an international equivalent, evidence of recent clinical activity, and relevant work experience as a registered dental surgeon. CV must include details of qualifications and experience.
structure: The program includes significant time in the oral medicine clinic and a dissertation unit, with closely supervised clinical experience.

title: MSc Palaeobiology
summary: The MSc Palaeobiology program at the University of Bristol is an interdisciplinary course designed for students interested in the history of life, mass extinctions, and fossil preservation. It provides training in phylogenetics, biomechanics, and macroevolution, preparing students for independent research or careers in various fields such as museum curation and science education. Students will also develop professional skills in research planning, problem-solving, and communication.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics subject is required. Other degrees may be considered with relevant work experience in laboratories or museums.
structure: The program consists of lectures, practical classes, and tutorials in the first part, followed by a research project leading to a written thesis.

title: MSc Periodontology
summary: The MSc in Periodontology at the University of Bristol is designed for dental practitioners seeking to enhance their evidence-based knowledge and technical skills in periodontal care. The program includes hands-on experience with surgical techniques and collaboration with a periodontal team, culminating in a research project and dissertation in the final year.
requirements: Typically requires a Bachelor of Dental Surgery or equivalent dental qualification, at least two years of post-graduation work experience in dentistry, and registration with the UK General Dental Council.
structure: Year 1 includes three theoretical/practical units delivered through distance learning and practical exercises. Year 2 continues with three additional units via distance learning. Year 3 culminates in a research project and dissertation.

title: MSc Policy Research

title: MSc Psychology (Conversion)
summary: The MSc Psychology (Conversion) program at the University of Bristol is designed for students from non-psychology backgrounds, providing training in contemporary psychological theories and methods. Students will learn to design research studies, analyze data, and conduct original empirical research, preparing them for further postgraduate study or careers in psychology. The program is accredited by the British Psychological Society, making graduates eligible for the Graduate Basis for Chartered Membership.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in any subject is required. The program is unsuitable for those who have previously completed a bachelor's degree in Psychology unless required due to accreditation.
structure: The program duration is one year full-time or two years part-time, with a focus on various psychological theories and research methods, culminating in a dissertation.

title: MSc Psychology of Education BPS
summary: The MSc Psychology of Education is a BPS-accredited conversion programme designed for individuals without a BPS-accredited psychology degree. It provides a comprehensive grounding in educational psychology, emphasizing research methods and their application in educational contexts. Students will develop transferable skills and be eligible for Graduate Basis for Chartered Membership with the BPS.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. If currently completing a degree, interim grades may be considered for an aspirational offer.
structure: The programme is structured to provide a solid foundation in psychology and research methods, with a focus on applying these to educational contexts.

title: MSc Public Health
summary: The MSc in Public Health at the University of Bristol focuses on developing knowledge and skills in health improvement, health protection, and healthcare services. The program is informed by high-quality research and addresses public health challenges both in the UK and internationally. Students will engage in various learning activities, including lectures, workshops, and a dissertation project, preparing them for careers in public health or further academic pursuits.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or equivalent in relevant fields such as Medicine, Nursing, or Social Sciences is required. A quantitative unit/module with a minimum of 55% or equivalent is also necessary. A-Level Mathematics Grade C or above, or equivalent qualifications are accepted.
structure: The program is campus-based with compulsory taught units and a dissertation undertaken in the final term and summer. It includes face-to-face lectures, practicals, group work, workshops, and seminars.
careers: lecturers, senior lecturers, and professors of public health

title: MSc Public Policy
summary: The MSc in Public Policy at the University of Bristol engages with contemporary policy concerns and the complexities of the policy environment. It prepares students for careers in policy planning, consultancy, and officer positions across various sectors, including government and NGOs. The program allows for specialization in substantive policy issues and emphasizes critical evaluation and development of policy alternatives.
requirements: Typically, an upper second class honours degree or international equivalent in a Social Science, Humanities, or related discipline is required. Relevant work experience (minimum 18 months) in policy work may also be considered.
structure: The program comprises six units plus a dissertation or a policy analysis capstone project. Four units are mandatory, and students can choose from various options.

title: MSc Reproduction and Development
summary: The MSc in Reproduction and Development is an innovative blended learning programme that provides a comprehensive understanding of human reproduction and development. It combines distance learning with short on-campus workshops in Bristol, focusing on the physiological basis of reproduction, clinical management of infertility, and cutting-edge research. Students will develop critical research skills and engage with experts in the field.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in Biological Science, Medicine, Medical Sciences, Clinical Science, or Human Sciences. Applications may be considered with slightly lower interim grades or additional relevant qualifications.
structure: The programme consists of six mandatory taught units and a research project unit, including a literature review, dissertation, and oral poster examination. The first three units are delivered online in Autumn, while the next three units are face-to-face in Bristol in January.

title: MSc Robotics
summary: The MSc Robotics program equips students with the skills to understand, design, and implement modern robotic systems across various sectors, including manufacturing and health. It offers practical research opportunities at the Bristol Robotics Laboratory, a leading center for robotics research. The program is jointly delivered by the University of Bristol and the University of the West of England, leveraging the expertise and resources of both institutions.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in any subject is required, along with a module in programming languages such as C/C++, Java, Python, or MATLAB. Experience in these languages can also be demonstrated through a CV or personal statement.
structure: The program includes core and optional units, with a significant research project in the second term that constitutes one third of the overall MSc. Students can collaborate with researchers at the Bristol Robotics Laboratory or industrial partners.

title: MSc Science Communication for a Better Planet
summary: The MSc in Science Communication for a Better Planet focuses on equipping students with a diverse set of science communication skills to address global challenges such as climate change and biodiversity crises. The program emphasizes collaboration, public trust, and scientific literacy, training students in techniques like natural history filmmaking, podcast creation, and outreach programs. Students will build a portfolio of communication outputs and gain work experience through a tailored final project.
requirements: Typically, a strong upper second class honours degree (65% or higher) or an international equivalent in subjects like Biology, Ecology, or Environmental Sciences is required. Relevant work experience or a postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The program is delivered over one year full-time, focusing on various science communication techniques and culminating in a four-month final project tailored to career aspirations.

title: MSc Scientific Computing with Data Science
summary: The MSc in Scientific Computing with Data Science at the University of Bristol is designed for recent graduates in the Physical or Life Sciences who wish to enhance their computing skills to advance scientific research. The program focuses on coding, machine learning, and high-performance computing, applying these skills to solve complex scientific problems. Students will gain hands-on experience through project work and interactive workshops, preparing them for a competitive job market.
requirements: Applicants should have an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in Natural/Physical Sciences or certain Life Sciences with demonstrated competency in Maths. Computing experience is not essential.
structure: The program includes compulsory units in scientific programming, research software engineering, data analysis methods, and a group project. Students will also complete an individual research project.

title: MSc Social and Cultural Theory
summary: The MSc in Social and Cultural Theory at the University of Bristol focuses on understanding culture as a core aspect of social life. Students will explore significant debates in sociological studies, engage with the work of key thinkers, and develop the skills to conduct independent cultural analyses. The program emphasizes critical thinking and the application of theory to contemporary social issues.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Applications may be considered with lower interim grades if the applicant has relevant work experience or a postgraduate qualification.
structure: The program includes a combination of mandatory and optional taught units assessed by essays, followed by a dissertation in the summer term.

title: MSc Social Innovation and Entrepreneurship
summary: The MSc in Social Innovation and Entrepreneurship at the University of Bristol equips students with the entrepreneurial skills needed to address societal challenges through sustainable ventures. The program emphasizes practical application and teamwork, allowing students to engage in real-world projects and develop innovative solutions. Graduates will be prepared to lead in the impact economy, creating measurable social and environmental change.
requirements: Typically, an upper second class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Additional qualifications or relevant work experience may be considered.
structure: The program is structured across three phases: Term 1 focuses on mastering core skills for social innovation, Term 2 involves applying skills in real-world business scenarios, and the Summer culminates in launching a new venture.
careers: Innovation and Change Leaders in FinTech companies
Programme Managers in international start-up ecosystems
Designers and Strategists within global firms

title: MSc Social Science Research Methods (Management)
summary: The requested course page could not be found, indicating that the course may no longer exist or the link is broken. Please refer to the University of Bristol's postgraduate study homepage for more information on available programs.

structure: Check website

title: MSc Social Science Research Methods (Politics)
summary: The MSc in Social Science Research Methods (Politics) at the University of Bristol provides ESRC-approved research training in politics and international relations. It equips students with practical methodological skills through hands-on experience and critical exploration of various research methods. The program is ideal for those aiming for a career as a social science researcher or pursuing a PhD, culminating in a dissertation that showcases research project management and analysis skills.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in any discipline is required. Applicants must have evidence of at least one quantitative and one qualitative module/unit at 2.1 or equivalent.
structure: The program includes a combination of mandatory and optional taught units assessed by essays, followed by a dissertation in the summer term.
careers: Research jobs in government or private sector

title: MSc Social Science Research Methods (Sociology)
summary: The MSc in Social Science Research Methods (Sociology) provides comprehensive training in research conceptualization, design, and operationalization, focusing on both qualitative and quantitative data collection methods. It is designed for those pursuing a career as a social science researcher or a PhD, with a strong emphasis on methodological training and ethical considerations in research. Students will engage with academic experts and contribute to human knowledge through a dissertation.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in any discipline is required, along with evidence of at least one quantitative and one qualitative module at 2.1 or equivalent. Relevant work experience or a postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The course includes a combination of mandatory and optional taught units, assessed by essays or equivalent submissions, followed by a dissertation in the summer term.

title: MSc Social Work
summary: The MSc in Social Work is a two-year professional program designed for individuals aiming to qualify and practice as social workers. It combines university-based learning with supervised practice in diverse settings, equipping graduates with the skills to support individuals in crisis and contribute to social work policy and practice. The program is recognized nationally and internationally, allowing graduates to register with Social Work England.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or international equivalent in any subject, plus English and Mathematics GCSE grade 4 (C) or above. A personal statement, CV, and one professional reference from a social care-related job or voluntary experience are also required.
structure: The program includes university-based learning and two extended periods of supervised practice across contrasting settings, along with skills training.

title: MSc Social Work Research

structure: Check website

title: MSc Socio-Legal Studies
summary: The MSc Socio-Legal Studies at the University of Bristol combines rigorous research training with interdisciplinary insights into the interaction between law and society. It prepares students to influence legal and social policies through empirical research and practical application, making it ideal for aspiring academics, PhD candidates, and professionals in the socio-legal field.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in Law or a related field such as Sociology, Social Policy, or Political Science. Significant academic or professional experience may also be considered.
structure: The programme includes two core units in the Law School and three core units in the School of Sociology, Politics and International Studies, with one optional unit. Assessment methods may include essays, presentations, or written examinations, culminating in a dissertation based on the chosen optional unit.

title: MSc Sociology
summary: The MSc Sociology program at the University of Bristol extends core sociological knowledge and provides specialized understanding in areas such as ethnicity, gender, and social movements. Students will develop critical comprehension of social theory and methodologies while engaging with contemporary sociological topics. The program culminates in a dissertation, allowing for in-depth exploration of a chosen sociological project.
requirements: Typically, an upper second-class honours degree or an international equivalent in any discipline is required. Relevant work experience or a postgraduate qualification may also be considered.
structure: The program includes a combination of mandatory and optional taught units, followed by a dissertation in the summer term.

title: MSc Stem Cells and Regeneration (Online)
summary: The requested course page could not be found, indicating that the course may no longer exist or the link is broken. Please refer to the postgraduate study homepage for more information on available programs.
requirements: Check website
structure: Check website

title: MSc Strategy, Change and Leadership
